commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic0197bbe1d12e03cae9f8e0b599d1087cf3aa934

subject: show the default value of limit with the description of API when we use this API to show the information of image but the count of images is more than 25 and we don't know the default limit from API information. how to configer the default value of limit

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27496, 'date': '2018-02-12 06:03:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-02-12 14:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Thanks for taking the time to fix our docs.  I have some problems with this patch (but also a suggestion for how to improve it).

The API reference describes how to consume the API.  Thus, it's not appropriate to include information about how to configure Glance here, since most readers (unless they also happen to be admins) are in no position to set or read the API configuration settings.

The current description of the 'limit' parameter indicates that the user can modify the number of items returned.  To me that implies that if you *don't* specify the parameter, you will get some default number of items.

I take it that the reason you want to improve this section of the docs is that people are sometimes fooled by the response (they expect to see all their images and are only looking at one page).  I think that's a legitimate concern.  But it's already addressed in the "Pagination" section of the image-list description: https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/index.html#show-images

I'd suggest re-reading that section, and if you think it's unclear or could be improved, propose a change there.

Thanks!'}]

commit_message:
show the default value of limit with the description of API
when we use this API to show the information of image
but the count of images is more than 25 and we don't know the default
limit from API information.
how to configer the default value of limit

Change-Id: Ie3ab136e4205eb788b15f64697b224c72ec87681

commit_message:
Filter port-list based on security_groups.

This patch allows users to filter ports depending on security groups.
In addition to that I added a unit test to verify this change.
TODO: move security_groups_port_filtering_lib.py into neutron-lib.

Closes-Bug: 1405057
Change-Id: I528719d895fc1d89f74e2ee85b9ddc470323c601

commit_message:
drop driver and topic settings in designate ctx

A similar change will land in designate to drop this extra topic as
well.

Also, driver and topic overrides in a service-specific context are not a
good idea.

Closes-Bug: #1710831
Closes-Bug: #1738100
(cherry picked from commit b89de21d47dc9114d20456452cd867041bcd83c5)

Change-Id: I9b5a2da8d4fc5c8816a860bcfd07b2af70aacd2f

subject: Fix string formatting in error messages
messages:
[{'account_id': 7080, 'date': '2017-10-17 00:16:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2017-10-17 10:22:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

Hi Mathieu

Thanks for this review; see inline comments for feedback.'}, {'account_id': 7080, 'date': '2018-01-21 19:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7080, 'date': '2018-01-21 19:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7080, 'date': '2018-01-21 19:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7080, 'date': '2018-01-21 19:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Cannot use format function in an implicit concatenation, unless it is the last member.

print("abc: {}".format(42) " hello") < is invalid
print("abc: " "{} hello".format(42)) < is valid

Opted for the latter by moving the size to the last line.'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-01-22 10:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-01-22 10:27:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Hi Mathieu

Change LGTM - I've requested full functional testing which is currently limited to core review team only to mitigate general meltdown/spectre issues in the cloud that runs these extended tests.

Once those pass we can get this landed - thankyou!"}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2018-02-12 13:38:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

LGTM, thanks'}]

commit_message:
Fix string formatting in error messages

Currently, error messages are returned with the string formatting templates
as-is. This seems like a last-minute line-length wrapping issue.

This commit fixes the string formatting.

Change-Id: I606f4b9be4e5597348ea42b41667c054965d2083

The deprecation notice on the Ceph charm links to the old

referenced Appendix on how to migrate off the ceph charm to
the ceph-mon and ceph-osd charms.

commit_message:
Update the Charm Deployment Guide Link

The deprecation notice on the Ceph charm links to the old
Charm Deployment Guide. The old version does not have the
referenced Appendix on how to migrate off the ceph charm to
the ceph-mon and ceph-osd charms.

Closes-Bug: 1736623

subject: Drop neutron::logging testing
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 15:59:47.000000000', 'message': "Drop neutron::logging testing

The neutron::logging class directly uses oslo::log which means
that unit testing it is a bit useless, as oslo::log is already
unit tested.

This means that we won't be breaking a ton of projects if we
make changes to oslo::log and how it configures things.

Change-Id: If8ae25e710487bad6512f9e65d8f674e9b1e60c6
"}]
commit_message:
Drop neutron::logging testing

The neutron::logging class directly uses oslo::log which means
that unit testing it is a bit useless, as oslo::log is already
unit tested.

This means that we won't be breaking a ton of projects if we
make changes to oslo::log and how it configures things.

Change-Id: If8ae25e710487bad6512f9e65d8f674e9b1e60c6

commit_message:
Fluentd: fixed configuration by service

The configuration file by service was not
properly configured.

Also clean some double tasks on the tests

Change-Id: I3149902401d68d6fd236073a73a20f982d4b952a

commit_message:
Add help for --plan, add --stack

In order to use tripleo-ansible-inventory with a different stack name,
you had to know to specify that name with --plan.

This commit adds help for the --plan cli arg, and also adds a new
--stack cli arg that has the same effect. --stack is more consistent
with other cli tools in TripleO. If both are specified, --stack will
take precedence.

Change-Id: I64b2c66eb2d37f0f231895c0cec3f8415de9f342

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I23871b397b597518132e0891fcaae8dcf3629456

commit_message:
l3_agent should only appear in computes when dvr

When using ovs_dvr, the routing capabilities should be distributed across
computes and controller. However, because group_when is a list, the
condition was always true and l3_agent was always deployed in the computes.
This patch changes the type of group_when so that it gets properly evaluated

Change-Id: I39fc50ca25731e44801e4ee32b07c550489f2a39

commit_message:
Add tripleo-ssh-known-hosts role

Support the SshKnownHostsDeployment resources from Heat with a new
Ansible role in tripleo-common for use by config-download. The new role
will configure /etc/ssh/ssh_known_hosts in the same manner that the Heat
deployments did.

Change-Id: I9314596f9ab48e95ba34d08dba9abfee2f8d2e0c
Partial-Bug: #1746336

commit_message:
Fix custom output dir for templates processor

Templates processor fails to locate *.j2 files,
when a custom output dir is specified.

Ensure *.j2 templates are on their expected search
paths for upcoming pasring and rendering

Change-Id: Idbc93e27574c66a9a5a73e3fcd7e88647282f201
Closes-bug: #1748425

I strongly believe we should keep the long time supported CLI interface, 'undercloud install', off containerized undercloud scenarios. Instead, we should keep develop that non-compatible experimental interface, 'undercloud deploy', instead.

This would free us off a lot of technical debt and snowballs of backwards-compat maintaining for the undercloud install managing containerized UC aside of the undercloud deploy."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-24 09:21:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 55:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-24 09:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 55:

As we discussed, we want to stick to 'undercloud install --use-heat'. I misunderstood the use cases for 'underclod deploy'. I'm not much happy to have both methods supported in quickstart and tripleo client and being diverged even more. But that's out of this patch scope.

Back to this patch, let's please make sure we're moved as much of the configurations specific and exclusive to quickstart to tripleo client. LGTM otherwise."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-25 09:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 56: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-01-25 09:01:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 56:

'}, {'created': '2018-01-31 17:25:44.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Update quickstart extras with undercloud install for containers

Remove packages installation from undercloud host prepare script
(partially addresses the tech debt). Dependencies are now managed
via the instack-undercloud-container, which is a sub-package that
contains all dependencies to deploy a containerized undercloud.
Python-tripleoclient installs it an install dependency.

Additional change: move undercloud_tripleo_pkg and
undercloud_rpm_dependencies (default to python-tripleoclient)
to the common vars and use those for undercloud host prep tasks
instead of a hardcode.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8
'}, {'created': '2018-01-31 20:02:44.000000000', 'message': 'Updates for containerized undercloud

Removing a bunch of technical debt but also updating undercloud-deploy
role to make it work with latest bits.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8

'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 19:45:34.000000000', 'message': 'Updates for containerized undercloud

This patch contains changes to deploy a containerized undercloud by
using: "openstack undercloud install --use-heat" command.

Details of the changes:

- The experimental containerized undercloud deployments driven via
  `undercloud deploy` CLI is not supported anymore for Pike.
- overcloud-prep-containers: fix an jinja2 syntax issue with "is defined"
- overcloud-prep-images: "--http-boot=/var/lib/ironic/httpboot" is
  added to the "openstack overcloud image upload" command.
- undercloud_rpm_dependencies parameter has been created, default to
  undercloud_tripleo_pkg value.
- Remove "undercloud_tripleo_pkg" so we only use
  "undercloud_rpm_dependencies". Note that "undercloud_tripleo_pkg"
  was only used in this repository.
- Remove "undercloud_update_packages" option which was technical debt.
- Add "undercloud_install_cli_options" option which is used to add extra
  options to "openstack undercloud install" command.
- Add "undercloud_container_images_file" which is the environment file
  with default parameters for containers to use with undercloud install CLI.
- Add "undercloud_custom_env_files" which provides custom t-h-t env files
  for the "undercloud install" `undercloud.conf` interface.
- Generate the undercloud prep containers script. This script will
  reproduce what we expect from our users to run with
  "openstack overcloud container image prepare" command, for the
  undercloud.
- Update undercloud-deploy.sh.j2, remove tech debt and update for new
  bits.
- Update undercloud-install.sh to use undercloud_install_cli_options
  which is empty by default but will be used in the container-undercloud
  featureset to override with the right parameters.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud

Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8
'}, {'created': '2018-02-09 09:42:34.000000000', 'message': 'Updates for containerized undercloud

This patch contains changes to deploy a containerized undercloud by
using: "openstack undercloud install --use-heat" command.

Details of the changes:

- The experimental containerized undercloud deployments driven via
  `undercloud deploy` CLI is not supported anymore for Pike.
- overcloud-prep-containers: fix an jinja2 syntax issue with "is defined"
- overcloud-prep-images: "--http-boot=/var/lib/ironic/httpboot" is
  added to the "openstack overcloud image upload" command.
- undercloud_rpm_dependencies parameter has been created, default to
  undercloud_tripleo_pkg value.
- Remove "undercloud_tripleo_pkg" so we only use
  "undercloud_rpm_dependencies". Note that "undercloud_tripleo_pkg"
  was only used in this repository.
- Remove "undercloud_update_packages" option which was technical debt.
- Add "undercloud_install_cli_options" option which is used to add extra
  options to "openstack undercloud install" command.
- Add "undercloud_container_images_file" which is the environment file
  with default parameters for containers to use with undercloud install CLI.
- Add "undercloud_custom_env_files" which provides custom t-h-t env files
  for the "undercloud install" `undercloud.conf` interface.
- Generate the undercloud prep containers script. This script will
  reproduce what we expect from our users to run with
  "openstack overcloud container image prepare" command, for the
  undercloud.
- Update undercloud-deploy.sh.j2, remove tech debt and update for new
  bits.
- Install heat libraries and other dependencies for containerized UC
  from python-tripleoclient-heat-installer. This should go away
  once python-tripleoclient installs python-tripleoclient-heat-installer
  automatically.
- Update undercloud-install.sh to use undercloud_install_cli_options
  which is empty by default but will be used in the container-undercloud
  featureset to override with the right parameters.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud

Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8

  undercloud.
- Update undercloud-deploy.sh.j2, remove tech debt and update for new
  bits.
- Install heat libraries and other dependencies for containerized UC
  from python-tripleoclient-heat-installer. This should go away
  once python-tripleoclient installs python-tripleoclient-heat-installer
  automatically.
- Update undercloud-install.sh to use undercloud_install_cli_options
  which is empty by default but will be used in the container-undercloud
  featureset to override with the right parameters.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud

Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8
'}]
commit_message:
Updates for containerized undercloud

This patch contains changes to deploy a containerized undercloud by
using: "openstack undercloud install --use-heat" command.

Details of the changes:

- The experimental containerized undercloud deployments driven via
  `undercloud deploy` CLI is not supported anymore for Pike.
- overcloud-prep-containers: fix an jinja2 syntax issue with "is defined"
- overcloud-prep-images: "--http-boot=/var/lib/ironic/httpboot" is
  added to the "openstack overcloud image upload" command.
- undercloud_rpm_dependencies parameter has been created, default to
  undercloud_tripleo_pkg value.
- Remove "undercloud_tripleo_pkg" so we only use
  "undercloud_rpm_dependencies". Note that "undercloud_tripleo_pkg"
  was only used in this repository.
- Remove "undercloud_update_packages" option which was technical debt.
- Add "undercloud_install_cli_options" option which is used to add extra
  options to "openstack undercloud install" command.
- Add "undercloud_container_images_file" which is the environment file
  with default parameters for containers to use with undercloud install CLI.
- Add "undercloud_custom_env_files" which provides custom t-h-t env files
  for the "undercloud install" `undercloud.conf` interface.
- Generate the undercloud prep containers script. This script will
  reproduce what we expect from our users to run with
  "openstack overcloud container image prepare" command, for the
  undercloud.
- Update undercloud-deploy.sh.j2, remove tech debt and update for new
  bits.
- Install heat libraries and other dependencies for containerized UC
  from python-tripleoclient-heat-installer. This should go away
  once python-tripleoclient installs python-tripleoclient-heat-installer
  automatically.
- Update undercloud-install.sh to use undercloud_install_cli_options
  which is empty by default but will be used in the container-undercloud
  featureset to override with the right parameters.

Partially-Implements: bp containerized-undercloud

Co-Authored-By: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Main <imain@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin André <m.andre@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I7d056b208d5ac0639e3277f3f4ae453a9ee639e8

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I0f084cbec5efc9498f97a4c675dcc590080eac90

[{'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-01-25 11:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-01-25 12:01:09.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to newton/occ-config'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-01-25 14:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-02 10:28:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:09:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-02-05 16:16:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

Let's not do this.

I think the ffu effort is putting too much reliance on this script, adding too much logic with unclear reasoning and introducing breakages.

Can you share any info about your plans with CI?

If you need to initially deploy a newton overcloud, then you must have newton tripleo-heat-templates somewhere available. Why can't you just use the script from there how it originally was?"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-06 11:37:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Let's not do this.
 > 
 > I think the ffu effort is putting too much reliance on this script,
 > adding too much logic with unclear reasoning and introducing
 > breakages.
 > 
 > Can you share any info about your plans with CI?

The main review is there https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525686/, it's basically a mixed version deployment with master undercloud and newton overcloud.  The topic branch is ffu/ci.

Is more needed ?
 > 
 > If you need to initially deploy a newton overcloud, then you must
 > have newton tripleo-heat-templates somewhere available. Why can't
 > you just use the script from there how it originally was?

That was my original idea as can be seen there[1], then I discovered a bug in newton get-occ-config.sh that would prevent the script from running at all.  So I switch to this review.

So, I've uploaded the review https://review.openstack.org/541245 to fix the newton get-occ-config and will restore the previously abandonned one[1] so that we can be certain of no breakage here.

WDYT ?

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535299/2/roles/overcloud-deploy/templates/deployed_server_prepare.sh.j2"}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-06 11:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

hum .. slight correction, the get-occ-config would run, but fails on first non existent role.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-06 11:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Ah, the other reason was https://review.openstack.org/#/c/536932/2/deployed-server/scripts/get-occ-config.sh that would need backport to newton.  So I though it would be simpler to just make that one in master.

But I get you point.'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-06 12:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2018-02-12 11:00:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

In favor of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541245/'}]

commit_message:
Allow get-occ-config to work with newton overcloud.

The metadata url mechanism isn’t working on newton overcloud.  We need
that for ffu mixed version testing to be working.

Change-Id: I97dd259b55c800a5c0bbbbeef654af85210581bb

[{'created': '2018-02-08 16:34:08.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration

Change-Id: I8ec196a62e7c0146f25045e643073f414ae69249
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I8ec196a62e7c0146f25045e643073f414ae69249

Turn py27 API gate on

We don't have obvious issues with py27-api gates. This patch turns it
on. We still need to look into tempest failure for lifecycle hook
problem.

commit_message:
Single table for scheduled and additional rooms

Collapse the "scheduled" and "additional" tracks tables into
a single table. This extends the "roomcode" helper to be
smart enough to guess what the cell should contain.

Change-Id: I60887d5da0878820817f17c9f4fd1aa20f546aac

subject: Remove redundant get_object call when creating fip qos binding
messages: [{'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-02-09 04:55:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-02-09 06:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-12 08:52:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 04:55:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant get_object call when creating fip qos binding

We try to fetch binding (and doing it wrong by passing incorrect OVO
class), and then return the result to callers. But no callers care about
the result, so it's useless work (and bad code).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I68b436c9a0665d276bcda30f414a79f4d83e3758
Related-Bug: #1746996
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant get_object call when creating fip qos binding

We try to fetch binding (and doing it wrong by passing incorrect OVO
class), and then return the result to callers. But no callers care about
the result, so it's useless work (and bad code).

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I68b436c9a0665d276bcda30f414a79f4d83e3758
Related-Bug: #1746996

commit_message:
Fix CI broke because of QoS interface and neutron DB interface changes

all_rules = qos_rule.get_rules(context, policy_id)
TypeError: get_rules() takes exactly 3 arguments (2 given)

qos_rule.get_rules() add a arguments (obj_cls) in this commit:
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-94eb611a8a3b29dbf8cd2aa2466a53b9R34

This code results in a DB commit for each operation (get_object/delete_object/update_object):
https://github.com/openstack/neutron/commit/6f83466307fb21aee5bb596974644d457ae1fa60#diff-7ed10a69652bc41264bbb5ae42eb8867R526
This led to the port's revision_number increase.

Change-Id: I5186e6f2aeff19d3f8b5b3685c6babc9e905dd85

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-10 13:43:53.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Bring idempotency to swapon"

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
we can try to understand the root cause and solve that properly.

As such, this is reverted. If the original issue comes up again then
we will figure out a different strategy.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
'}, {'created': '2018-02-10 13:48:02.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Bring idempotency to swapon"

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
we can try to understand the root cause and solve that properly.

As such, this is reverted. If the original issue comes up again then
we will figure out a different strategy.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
'}, {'created': '2018-02-10 13:56:50.000000000', 'message': "bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
the task to enable swap is now fully idempotent too, so the reason
for the initial implementation is also solved.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
"}, {'created': '2018-02-10 13:57:38.000000000', 'message': "bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043 and
implements a more targeted solution.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
the task to enable swap is now fully idempotent too, so the reason
for the initial implementation is also solved.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8
"}]
commit_message:
bootstrap-host: Create swap without using a failed task

This reverts commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043 and
implements a more targeted solution.

Unfortunately this implementation's of a try/rescue system which
will always fail the try on a fresh system causes a lot of confusion
for anyone new to OSA. When seeing the reported failed task the
user thinks something went wrong, even though it was working as
designed.

The main.yml uses a conditional include for the execution of these
tasks only if the current swap available < 1MB. This should be enough
to prevent the tasks executing again. If they do execute again, then
the task to enable swap is now fully idempotent too, so the reason
for the initial implementation is also solved.

Change-Id: I7be78780505f14fb1b581d22d4762a34cd2005d8

commit_message:
Handle error response for webob>=1.6.0

WebOb change https://github.com/Pylons/webob/pull/230 changed
the way in which the error response body is formatted such that
it's no longer a nested dict. So we have to handle both the
old convention of an error message key to the response body error
dict and the new way with just the error body dict.

This was reported upstream:
https://github.com/Pylons/webob/issues/235

But given this was apparently implemented as a long-overdue change
in WebOb the behavior is not likely to change.

Change-Id: Id8bfde6277640de48768bbe5a5e4252b97253ed2
Closes-Bug: #1559072
Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add a tox env to run renderspec against rpm-packaging

When changing renderspec, the important part is to not break the
existing spec templates from the openstack/rpm-packaging project.
So add a script and a job which can render all available templates.

Change-Id: Ib18e6e47e16ac1ed3f6770b9e61fcf72dfd10ed7

commit_message:
Running new workflow based on existing execution.

This is the client side work which will allow the operator
to execute a new workflow based on the input of the same
running workflow.

Depends-On: Iec3d9f3a71a98952860b972acd09ce80e0a849ff
Change-Id: Ib725c68246f263bdbd31655114157cc737ab07f7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
(cherry picked from commit e2ff3df5e89ba8ff271bf6db6d2dc57aab2a9bb4)

commit_message:
show which repos use a library

Use the codesearch service to find repositories that use a library to
make it easier to anticipate the impact of releasing a new
version. Only official repositories are included.

Change-Id: I656d9bb09d1b4ed485a29061dede8ab86ef5bdca
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Validate volume status again when snapshot created

In a multitask environment, the volume can be deleted
after the snapshot record is created. Add the validation
right after the creation to avoid undeletable snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1739995

Change-Id: Icbe86473243871996483fdc96c079b8861bac2e5

commit_message:
add validation step for pypi permissions

Projects that are going to try to upload releases to PyPI need to have
given openstackci permission to do that.

Change-Id: I8e5e60ea6bf2842e834d2352134a11b1f9fe02b9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-31 15:39:20.000000000', 'message': 'Update glance NFS for systemd

Systemd has the ability to manage mounts and ensure functionality
/ resource management. Using a systemd mount has the benifit of not
requiring writes to the legacy fstab file which can impact OS
functionality especially when deploying on baremetal. This change
moves the glance NFS mount to a systemd unit file allowing systemd
to manage it independently with no potentially breaking impact to
the underlying operating system.

Changes:
 - This PR corrects a long standing issue when using Glance+NFS where
   initial deployment would work but if the playbooks were run again
   it would fail due to the glance images location being an NFS mount
   point with a potentially different UID/GID. To correct this we stat
   the directory and if it does NOT exist it is created.
 - Following the nova pattern options have been provided to set the UID
   and GID of the glance user.
 - To ensure out NFS backend solution works with the installation of
   glance a test has been added to deploy glance using an NFS backend.
 - An upgrade task has been added to this commit to clean up legacy
   mounts, This task should be removed in R.

Change-Id: I716c9fe35391629532e67e212d45ea27a5422d1b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 477d44cab947a1d5db68bfaa240eb753ad9fabf0)
'}, {'created': '2018-02-10 16:44:32.000000000', 'message': 'Update glance NFS for systemd

functionality especially when deploying on baremetal. This change
moves the glance NFS mount to a systemd unit file allowing systemd

 - Following the nova pattern options have been provided to set the UID
   and GID of the glance user.
 - To ensure out NFS backend solution works with the installation of
   glance a test has been added to deploy glance using an NFS backend.
 - An upgrade task has been added to this commit to clean up legacy
   mounts, This task should be removed in R.

Change-Id: I716c9fe35391629532e67e212d45ea27a5422d1b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 477d44cab947a1d5db68bfaa240eb753ad9fabf0)
'}]
commit_message:
Update glance NFS for systemd

Systemd has the ability to manage mounts and ensure functionality
/ resource management. Using a systemd mount has the benifit of not
requiring writes to the legacy fstab file which can impact OS
functionality especially when deploying on baremetal. This change
moves the glance NFS mount to a systemd unit file allowing systemd
to manage it independently with no potentially breaking impact to
the underlying operating system.

Changes:
 - This PR corrects a long standing issue when using Glance+NFS where
   initial deployment would work but if the playbooks were run again
   it would fail due to the glance images location being an NFS mount
   point with a potentially different UID/GID. To correct this we stat
   the directory and if it does NOT exist it is created.
 - Following the nova pattern options have been provided to set the UID
   and GID of the glance user.
 - To ensure out NFS backend solution works with the installation of
   glance a test has been added to deploy glance using an NFS backend.
 - An upgrade task has been added to this commit to clean up legacy
   mounts, This task should be removed in R.

Change-Id: I716c9fe35391629532e67e212d45ea27a5422d1b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 477d44cab947a1d5db68bfaa240eb753ad9fabf0)

commit_message:
update get_release_type to take a repo name

Instead of passing a full project dict, pass just the value we
need. This will let us reuse this function in places where we don't
have a project dict.

Change-Id: Id25e98c7b6dbf3cfb711447394f2d9ade5fc5674
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Running new workflow based on existing execution.

This is the client side work which will allow the operator
to execute a new workflow based on the input of the same
running workflow.

Depends-On: Iec3d9f3a71a98952860b972acd09ce80e0a849ff
Change-Id: Ib725c68246f263bdbd31655114157cc737ab07f7
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 03:01:27.000000000', 'message': 'Containerized undercloud doc updates

- Document the feature as experimental now, as we don't really support
  it, and it was more a developer feature; however, we aim to ship it
  for production during Rocky.
- Use "undercloud install" method instead of "undercloud deploy".

Change-Id: Ia33ff4e311d762285a6fd2956adb288b4bfb8013
'}]
commit_message:
Containerized undercloud doc updates

- Document the feature as experimental now, as we don't really support
  it, and it was more a developer feature; however, we aim to ship it
  for production during Rocky.
- Use "undercloud install" method instead of "undercloud deploy".

Change-Id: Ia33ff4e311d762285a6fd2956adb288b4bfb8013

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 22:33:54.000000000', 'message': 'Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia5a79117643c2e55cc3319fbca4e6e8a083f32ba
'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Use build_timeout for WC in test_os_wait_condition

commit_message:
Pull release specific containers when appropriate

Now that we're releasing pike, we need to pull the pike containers when
deploying a pike overcloud, instead of pulling the containers tagged
with 'latest'.

Change-Id: I0d937f27287d1ec7bc8b0ae14fa2b02ba168eee4
Closes-Bug: #1716280

subject: Add apt-get update in application deployment
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 02:53:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add apt-get update in application deployment

apt-get update should be performed first before installing the
debian packages, otherwise it may breaks during the application
script execution in tests.

Change-Id: I0c2e35fe1c05182ab7a9db094f787df9a8df1248
'}]
commit_message:
Add apt-get update in application deployment

apt-get update should be performed first before installing the
debian packages, otherwise it may breaks during the application
script execution in tests.

Change-Id: I0c2e35fe1c05182ab7a9db094f787df9a8df1248

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I6686b6c6ef636162b1b009407ea2b07a02c4c37d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 16:44:12.000000000', 'message': 'Deploy of keystone fails if api_interface names differ

If control hosts have different names of interfaces one can set
api_interface variables per host. Deployment of keystone fails
because rpc_transport_url and notify_transport_url variables
use bare api_interface instead of one from hostvars.

Change-Id: I8bb4aa2953cf4ba63ef6815f2504d35e5aa0a07b
Closes-Bug: #1748473
'}]
commit_message:
Deploy of keystone fails if api_interface names differ

If control hosts have different names of interfaces one can set
api_interface variables per host. Deployment of keystone fails
because rpc_transport_url and notify_transport_url variables
use bare api_interface instead of one from hostvars.

Change-Id: I8bb4aa2953cf4ba63ef6815f2504d35e5aa0a07b
Closes-Bug: #1748473

commit_message:
Set proper yum repo priority on CentOS 7

This patch ensures that we get galera from the MariaDB repos
and not from RDO.

Change-Id: I2c8e4e64c2425cd36903ae9288bd9fee29eef355
(cherry picked from commit dfb3d59dfb87eedb84a3e7b0bafb3764dd8a2cfa)

subject: Reject metrics 2 min in future or 2 weeks in past
messages:
[{'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:50:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14273, 'date': '2018-02-09 19:46:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 20:07:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 20:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26702, 'date': '2018-02-09 20:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This change leads to data loss as metrics will not reach the DB.  Also it makes caching in the client irrelevant in case of disconnect.

Has this been discussed?'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 20:22:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yes this does lead to data loss but the API shouldn't be receiving any metrics further than 2 min in the future anyway because that would point to an ntp problem. 
My previous patch did not take caching into consideration, which was a mistake. It should give the forwarder a reasonable amount of time to catch up, but I do think that the 2 weeks the Java API allows is sufficient."}, {'account_id': 26702, 'date': '2018-02-09 20:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I don’t see how this is change can improve the API.

Add an optional configuration option to enable this behavior.

Also, will the time stamp and code change account for DST?'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 21:07:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This patch is simply meant to parody the Java implementation's behavior https://github.com/openstack/monasca-api/blob/master/java/src/main/java/monasca/api/app/command/CreateMetricCommand.java#L60 . It is a bug to accept any timestamp"}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 21:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 26702, 'date': '2018-02-09 21:56:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This is not a desirable feature.

Make it optional.'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 22:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

With regard to DST, timestamps are represented in seconds since the epoch, so DST will never result in a loss of data
I am more than happy to address any concerns you have, so please let me know what is undesirable'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-09 22:22:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Since you are uncomfortable with the change. I will make it optional, with a default to the old behavior.'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2018-02-10 00:08:23.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543054'}, {'account_id': 26702, 'date': '2018-02-10 10:06:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

The monasca API needs to be able to ingest data in the past as well as in the future.  The most critical reason is to avoid data loss.  E.G. an old agent that comes back online needs to be able to send the data to the API.. An external application wants to send data for threshold management, etc.  Moreover an external system (like a ML prediction) needs to be able to post metrics in the future.

All in all this feature if it gets implemented needs to be disabled by default and with both a higher and lower bound configurable.  It is unlikely that 2 minutes is a the ideal value and needs to be configurable.

Additionally, the description and the code change diverges.  The description says that any events in the past or in the future within a 2 min range will be rejected.  The code implementation rejects events 2min in the future and 2 weeks in the past.

Finally i am unsure DST would not affect the boundaries.  Basically during DST, 2 weeks is not equal to 2 x 14 x 24h, ie TWO_WEEKS = 2 * 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000 is false.'}]

commit_message:
Reject metrics 2 min in future or 2 weeks in past

The Java Monasca API rejects any metric more than 2 min in the
future or 2 weeks in the past and the Python Monasca API should
parody that behaviour

Change-Id: Id20db771c3737b0ed91187ec7b44c4d729916da5

commit_message:
Allow force-delete even if task_state is not None

As of now, if vm task_state is not 'None', and user tries
to force-delete instance, then he gets HTTP 500 Error
and instance deletion doesn't progress.

The same is not the case, when user tries with delete api
instead of force-delete api, even if vm task_state is not 'None'.

Fixed the issue by allowing force-delete to delete instance
in task_state other than None.

Change-Id: Ida1a9d8761cec9585f031ec25e5692b8bb55661e
Closes-Bug: #1741000

commit_message:
[env][openstack] Change format of info method

The info method of existing@openstack returns a dict with information
about available services. The key isservice types, the value is
service name. It is convenient for code usage, but not obvious for the
users, as much as "__unknown__" service name.

This patch changes the format to be a list of dicts. Each dict is a
representation of available service. The service type is represented via
"type" field and name (if available) is represented via "name" field.

Also, the new format allows to provide more info about services in
future.

Change-Id: I4be4468d4a78ceb43e1bfa97c35c396606aa4da2

Change-Id: I76608deaefc68dbd5a99a3339584c9cf70e16ba0
'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 19:24:46.000000000', 'message': 'port more things to use envmanager

* Port rally.task.engine to use EnvManager instead of Deployment
* Rename method `set_deployment` of `rally.common.objects.Verifier`
  to `set_env`. It can be done in backward incompatible way, since the
  original method should be called only from rally.api
* Extend `rally.common.objects.Verifier` with `env` property
* Move OpenStackCredential under dict parenthood. object like style
  makes things too complicated. The simple dict should give more
  transparency. As for backward compatibility old-behaviour is kept.
* Call `check_helth` method of EnvManager from TaskEngine instead of
  hardcoded for openstack `verify_connection` method.
* Remove methods `get_validation_context` and `verify_connection` from
  OpenStackCredential. It should not be called anywhere.

Change-Id: I76608deaefc68dbd5a99a3339584c9cf70e16ba0
'}, {'created': '2018-02-09 00:21:50.000000000', 'message': '[wip] port more things to use envmanager

* Port rally.task.engine to use EnvManager instead of Deployment
* Rename method `set_deployment` of `rally.common.objects.Verifier`
  to `set_env`. It can be done in backward incompatible way, since the
  original method should be called only from rally.api
* Extend `rally.common.objects.Verifier` with `env` property
* Move OpenStackCredential under dict parenthood. object like style
  makes things too complicated. The simple dict should give more
  transparency. As for backward compatibility old-behaviour is kept.
* Call `check_helth` method of EnvManager from TaskEngine instead of
  hardcoded for openstack `verify_connection` method.
* Remove methods `get_validation_context` and `verify_connection` from
  OpenStackCredential. It should not be called anywhere.

Change-Id: I76608deaefc68dbd5a99a3339584c9cf70e16ba0

commit_message:
port more things to use envmanager

* Port rally.task.engine to use EnvManager instead of Deployment
* Rename method `set_deployment` of `rally.common.objects.Verifier`
  to `set_env`. It can be done in backward incompatible way, since the
  original method should be called only from rally.api
* Extend `rally.common.objects.Verifier` with `env` property
* Move OpenStackCredential under dict parenthood. object like style
  makes things too complicated. The simple dict should give more
  transparency. As for backward compatibility old-behaviour is kept.
* Call `check_helth` method of EnvManager from TaskEngine instead of
  hardcoded for openstack `verify_connection` method.
* Remove methods `get_validation_context` and `verify_connection` from
  OpenStackCredential. It should not be called anywhere.

Change-Id: I76608deaefc68dbd5a99a3339584c9cf70e16ba0

subject: Don't catch exceptions in quota manager
messages: [{'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-02-12 02:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-02-12 03:06:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2018-02-12 04:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 02:22:05.000000000', 'message': "Don't catch exceptions in quota manager

For these exceptions it is probably safer to actually
raise them and throw a 500. That way a notification
goes out, and we deal with it and potentially rerun the
actions.

The responsibility is on the deployer to correctly configure
the QUOTA_SERVICES setting, and eventually we will also add
checking against the catalog for service types in a given
region.

Change-Id: I3fa6013cb3dd02ae40109a10c79211e55cb73ef8
"}, {'created': '2018-02-12 03:06:43.000000000', 'message': "Don't catch exceptions in quota manager

For these exceptions it is probably safer to actually
raise them and throw a 500. That way a notification
goes out, and we deal with it and potentially rerun the

The responsibility is on the deployer to correctly configure
the QUOTA_SERVICES setting, and eventually we will also add

Change-Id: I3fa6013cb3dd02ae40109a10c79211e55cb73ef8
"}]
commit_message:
Don't catch exceptions in quota manager

For these exceptions it is probably safer to actually
raise them and throw a 500. That way a notification
goes out, and we deal with it and potentially rerun the
actions.

The responsibility is on the deployer to correctly configure
the QUOTA_SERVICES setting, and eventually we will also add
checking against the catalog for service types in a given
region.

Change-Id: I3fa6013cb3dd02ae40109a10c79211e55cb73ef8

commit_message:
Smaller Quota changes ignore change history

Update the quota logic to ignore change history
if the current change in quota is downward.

Change-Id: Iacbab882c3031db3d126a15dfb42c3cc8baa713e
Fixes-Bug: 1746137

commit_message:
Add bandit-baseline check job.

As bandit-baseline check just call tox to run tests, adding it to
in-tree checks instead of gate jobs.

Closes-Bug: #1618549
Change-Id: If6848c69e09117789d566ae47977034d5503fa09
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Reorder playbooks for better efficiency

This change reorders our setup playbooks to ensure we're running the
included playbooks in an efficient and effective order.

Change-Id: I01f0f0cd7d1f4328d51b70cc46663de83676b54e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Install ceph repo before install the ceph packages

In the centos, the ceph installs will failed if the ceph repo
package is not installed.
Install the ceph repo first.

Change-Id: I19c1f6005a0ee6cd4c564c17fe98f6e5bf6fcff0
Closes-Bug: #1578494

  as the actual large amount

[{'created': '2017-12-17 12:26:24.000000000', 'message': 'Drop django <= 1.10 support

horizon team will drop Django <= 1.10 support in Queens release
considering the Django roadmap [1].
heat-dashboard consumes the job definitions of py27-dj1(8|9|10)
in horizon, so they need to be dropped so that the horizon team
will drop the job definitions.

Django 2.0 released in December in Queens cycle (per Debian request).

[1] https://www.djangoproject.com/weblog/2015/jun/25/roadmap/

Change-Id: I157ffe73b763fd23043a251dba02efe10109c0c7
'}, {'created': '2018-02-11 00:33:45.000000000', 'message': 'Drop django <= 1.10 support

horizon team will drop Django <= 1.10 support in Rocky release
considering the Django roadmap [1].
heat-dashboard consumes the job definitions of py27-dj1(8|9|10)
in horizon, so they need to be dropped so that the horizon team
will drop the job definitions.

This prevents horizon team from removing these jobs.
If heat-dashboard still needs them, define your own versions.

[1] https://www.djangoproject.com/weblog/2015/jun/25/roadmap/

Change-Id: I157ffe73b763fd23043a251dba02efe10109c0c7
'}]
commit_message:
Drop django <= 1.10 support

horizon team will drop Django <= 1.10 support in Rocky release
considering the Django roadmap [1].
heat-dashboard consumes the job definitions of py27-dj1(8|9|10)
in horizon, so they need to be dropped so that the horizon team
will drop the job definitions.

This prevents horizon team from removing these jobs.
If heat-dashboard still needs them, define your own versions.

[1] https://www.djangoproject.com/weblog/2015/jun/25/roadmap/

Change-Id: I157ffe73b763fd23043a251dba02efe10109c0c7

[{'created': '2018-02-12 00:35:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix issues in quota manager editing settings module

Introduced in 'Update the QUOTA_SERVICES config to be a region mapping'
was a pop while processing a setting. This meant following calls
already popped the setting and incorrectly executed. This makes
a local copy of the settings dict and uses that instead.

Change-Id: I72d865d4456d5779c219cf3b48557dd699c45dbc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix issues in quota manager editing settings module

Introduced in 'Update the QUOTA_SERVICES config to be a region mapping'
was a pop while processing a setting. This meant following calls
already popped the setting and incorrectly executed. This makes
a local copy of the settings dict and uses that instead.

Change-Id: I72d865d4456d5779c219cf3b48557dd699c45dbc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 14:44:54.000000000', 'message': "overcloud-prep-containers allow override of deploy args

For those of us who use quickstart just to bootstrap a local test environment
it's a little inconvenient having the deploy args hard-coded here, so enable
local override via an environment file, so that you can potentially run
the script multiple times with different configurations and/or against different
t-h-t trees without having to re-run quickstart or hack up the script.

Change-Id: I796e9f1aff1a6c524b483d8261a810477c7ba97a
"}]
commit_message:
overcloud-prep-containers allow override of deploy args

For those of us who use quickstart just to bootstrap a local test environment
it's a little inconvenient having the deploy args hard-coded here, so enable
local override via an environment file, so that you can potentially run
the script multiple times with different configurations and/or against different
t-h-t trees without having to re-run quickstart or hack up the script.

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers

Sync charm-helpers to pick up the updated InternalEndpointContext
which removes the need to provide a package.

This essentially reverts commit 7620ce89 in favor of an alternative
approach to selecting the volume catalog endpoint information.

Change-Id: I20c2db2d30462d1d6fcbc7578a59eb2b4b790c83
Related-Bug: #1733566

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
messages: [{'account_id': 22818, 'date': '2018-02-11 18:17:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 20:09:42.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib3335e3ce398c95a10e97cec5cae5e7bee16d2e3
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib3335e3ce398c95a10e97cec5cae5e7bee16d2e3

commit_message:
Remove support of creating volume from Nova.

Current Nova server volume support is broken. Nova also declared the
'os-volumes_boot' will be deprecated in the future. As creating volumes
by cinderclient has been supoorted for a long time, we could just drop
support of Nova server volume.

This patch also migrate to the new block_device_mapping_v2 parameter of
Nova servers creating API.

Closes-Bug: #1673408
Change-Id: I74d86241a5a0d0b1804b959313432168f68faf89
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 09:21:26.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused permission setting

when ansible use file module to create directory, the owner and
group is root:root, besides that {{ node_config_directory }} just
volume to container, the config file will be move to
{{ node_config_directory }} will proper permission [0] [1], so the
user and group setting for directory is unnessary. this patch to
remove it.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.json.j2#L6
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova-compute.json.j2#L6

Change-Id: I987becde489f4b509b32edc1deceabfa2d2e1b74
'}, {'created': '2018-01-22 09:22:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused permission setting tasks

when ansible use file module to create directory, the owner and
group is root:root, besides that {{ node_config_directory }} just
volume to container, the config file will be move to
{{ node_config_directory }} will proper permission [0] [1], so the
user and group setting for directory is unnessary. this patch to
remove it.

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/glance/templates/glance-api.json.j2#L6
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/kolla-ansible/blob/master/ansible/roles/nova/templates/nova-compute.json.j2#L6

'}, {'created': '2018-01-22 09:25:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused permission setting tasks

group is root:root, besides that {{ node_config_directory }} just
volume to container, the config file will be move to
{{ container_config_directory }} will proper permission [0] [1],
so the user and group setting for directory is unnessary. this
patch to remove it.

commit_message:
Add the missing permission setting for external-ceph

when non-root (become), the permission changed is necessary,
but some roles is missing, the patch to add it.

Change-Id: I987becde489f4b509b32edc1deceabfa2d2e1b74

Sync in the charm-helpers to use the new VolumeAPIContext object
in order to determine the volume catalog info to use in the
configuration file.

which separates the concerns for volume endpoint context and
internal endpoint context.

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers and use VolumeAPIContext

Sync in the charm-helpers to use the new VolumeAPIContext object
in order to determine the volume catalog info to use in the
configuration file.

This is simply an alternative implementation for commit 16ae06bf
which separates the concerns for volume endpoint context and
internal endpoint context.

Change-Id: I187bc8ef5644a59dc5a0b5f7ad66774812a78b78
Related-Bug: #1733566

commit_message:
Sync charm-helpers and use VolumeAPIContext

Sync in the charm-helpers to use the new VolumeAPIContext object
in order to determine the volume catalog info to use in the
configuration file.

This is simply an alternative implementation for commit 5d92bc9f.
This will separate concerns for determining internal endpoints
and determining volume api versions.

Change-Id: I91009e1f9643f818b6f97898aa5d7c43e84684ed
Related-Bug: #1733566

commit_message:
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_MULTIDOMAIN_SUPPORT expects boolean

Previously the single domain mode has been implemented. This is a
follow-up commit to set the value properly as boolean instead of string.

Change-Id: I0e34d93d05693bf0ca5e8f68bc9af198fd29680a
Closes-Bug: #1744346
Related-Bug: #1712999
(cherry picked from commit 48119619a0df4445432bfcbcb0a5a0a585226774)

use. It is a staging ground where containers are tested for promotion
purposes before being pushed to docker.io.

commit_message:
Use a venv with previous ansible version for upgrades

When doing the role upgrade, we run every playbook with current's
branch ansible. This is normal for the infrastructure bits (which
are running on current branch), but not for the installation of
the previous branch's role, which should use previous branch's
environment.

Related-Bug: #1741471
Depends-On: I7ebb045885dd645b820de2b7f75b46c755c015f6
Change-Id: I7bc4dd644c48b403e9e669cb0ea460d9d1149410

commit_message:
Use a venv with previous ansible version for upgrades

When doing the role upgrade, we run every playbook with current's
branch ansible. This is normal for the infrastructure bits (which
are running on current branch), but not for the installation of
the previous branch's role, which should use previous branch's
environment. This script already exists for some OSA roles to
facilitate upgrades but we are now moving it to the tests
repository so all roles can benefit from it.

(Original patch 91b7524603650edbef984fd9fe83e352b90604d2)
Link: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/34790
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Closes-Bug: #1741471

Change-Id: I7ebb045885dd645b820de2b7f75b46c755c015f6

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.0.0

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo.

The OpenStack services SHA's will be manually updated in another
patch.

Change-Id: I78d85f33926bc979f7d0df0adc8e8245bf1223ad

commit_message:
Default to docker.io instead of trunk.registry.rdoproject.org

trunk.registry.rdoproject.org is not meant for production or stable
use. It is a staging ground where containers are tested for promotion
purposes before being pushed to docker.io.

Change-Id: Ie834ee076d9922ed67a8043dfab6ae04e07acd77

[{'created': '2018-02-10 14:24:07.000000000', 'message': "tests: test-galera-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: If6f0adb93bcc6e2cae3885017c58159f3dca1772

commit_message:
tests: test-galera-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: If6f0adb93bcc6e2cae3885017c58159f3dca1772

commit_message:
add deployed_server variable

deployed_server is no longer common
through out the multinode featuresets.
deploy_steps_ansible_workflow is an
alternative now.

commit_message:
Fix MySQL access denied error during upgrade

This change makes it so that if preconfigured database users are used,
the attempt to change the log_bin_trust_function_creators mysql
variable isn't made anymore.

Also updated the upgrade docs

Change-Id: I356313952d435de6d3b5444c0dd8a71f45aee452
Closes-Bug: 1748269

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I5296ec64c4aade4c89365084d95eb273fe4cd417
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I5296ec64c4aade4c89365084d95eb273fe4cd417

with other OpenStack Charms.

* fixes tox.ini to run xenial-ocata as Panko is only available in Ocata;

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 17:13:45.000000000', 'message': "apparmor: Fix use with directory based OSD's

Ensure that directory based OSD's under /srv/ceph can hard
link when apparmor is in enforce mode. If not, then links go
missing over time and the ceph-osd daemons eventually abort.

Change-Id: I7cc25f5d436204d1f47c9a3a67a15f27c16b7505
Closes-Bug: 1748426
(cherry picked from commit c4473c291634ea9e962827b02d2b30d9a033cbbc)
"}]
commit_message:
apparmor: Fix use with directory based OSD's

Ensure that directory based OSD's under /srv/ceph can hard
link when apparmor is in enforce mode. If not, then links go
missing over time and the ceph-osd daemons eventually abort.

Change-Id: I7cc25f5d436204d1f47c9a3a67a15f27c16b7505
Closes-Bug: 1748426
(cherry picked from commit c4473c291634ea9e962827b02d2b30d9a033cbbc)

subject: Add volume-type-list to OSC
messages:
[{'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-01-23 15:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-24 02:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-01-24 06:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-01-24 06:15:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

> (6 comments)

update.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-24 12:11:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Besides all the inline comments, I found the trove volume type api is duplicated to the cinder api, so it should be deprecated.

However when there are volume types associated to a datastore version, only these associated volume types could be used to create trove instances. So in fact only the 'list_datastore_version_associated_volume_types' in troveclient.v1.volume_types:VolumeTypes is needed, but this interface also exposed by trove-manage, as it's acutally an administration operation.

To conclude, I this it's not neccessary to implement volume-types related commands in the osc plugin."}, {'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-02-11 07:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add volume-type-list to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the volume-type-list command

The trove command volume-type-list is now:
    openstack database volume type list

Change-Id: Ia6a850f41e94f47abea9803aa06ee48f27e2174c
Partially-Implements: blueprint trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Changing logging to oslo_log

The oslo.log lib provides standardized log functions for all openstack
projects. It is better to use the common logging module instead of logging

Change-Id: I80630ca844cb07137af614fad57e9f425a39717e

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Idea4e5ff3923aeea34eec9ef40b2021bb3c32857

commit_message:
Use constants for cinder-volume

Since we have defined constants.VOLUME_BINARY, this patch
change some cinder volume binary strings to use constans.VOLUME_BINARY.

Change-Id: I91b1ed2331a3b197a2ba39fa5cfb02e9d161d709

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-09 08:14:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix order of arguments in assertIs

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected The expected value.
  observed The observed value.
  message An optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I98980030142f135a87a880a33aa03aad0f959476
"}]
commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertIs

Some tests used incorrect order assertIs(observed, expected).
The correct order expected by testtools is

assertIs(expected, observed, message='')
Assert that expected is observed.
Parameters:
  expected The expected value.
  observed The observed value.
  message An optional message describing the error.
https://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html

Change-Id: I98980030142f135a87a880a33aa03aad0f959476

If an error occurs when search images,It will always be

commit_message:
Handle exception on searching for images

If an error occurs when search images,It will always be
a "creating" state, although the container has failed to create.
Add exception in in searching for images when create containers.

Change-Id: Ic1f3dd27e99bdf70848f7ca8750543fc30452350
Closes-bug: #1747374
(cherry picked from commit 9c095cc4db3eccb6c2fefc6df01e46af0925cc01)

commit_message:
Skip and not fail auto allocate test

When a precondition is not met we should skip the test as opposed to fail.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ifb3f7427ff9863c6f1f1680790484430d964f52b

commit_message:
Fix the smoke test error

1. What is the problem?

the smoke test can not pass, because the

new version of openstack-sdk change.

2. What is the solution to the problem?

use the new method for the new version openstack-sdk.

3. What the features to be implemented in the Tricircle to realize the solution?

No new features.

Change-Id: I642086dac5d1320c7a04adf756b9bfe74a08a68c
Signed-off-by: song baisen <songbaisen@szzt.com.cn>
Co-Authored-By: zhiyuan_cai <luckyvega.g@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-22 03:05:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add security headers to web accessable services.

Adds the following headers as static:

    X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
    X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
    append Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self' https: wss:;"

nosniff prevents non-executable mime times from becoming executable.
The X-XSS-Protection header will prevent the loading of a page if the
browser detects an xss attack.  The Content-Security-Policy declares
what dynamic resources are allowed to load.

Adds the following header as user-setable via the
keystone_x_frame_options variable.

    X-Frame-Options "DENY"

By default the X-Frame-Options header denies embedding in an iframe.

Change-Id: Iadd3e93bdb7e9d41ae1d027196367448dbce19f1
Partial-Bug: 1717321
(cherry picked from commit 81a28142a065e07f16756b1bc4cfb68a98e0a2e9)

commit_message:
Add security headers to web accessable services.

Adds the following headers as static:

    X-Content-Type-Options "nosniff"
    X-XSS-Protection "1; mode=block"
    append Content-Security-Policy "default-src 'self' https: wss:;"

nosniff prevents non-executable mime times from becoming executable.
The X-XSS-Protection header will prevent the loading of a page if the
browser detects an xss attack.  The Content-Security-Policy declares
what dynamic resources are allowed to load.

Adds the following header as user-setable via the
keystone_x_frame_options variable.

    X-Frame-Options "DENY"

By default the X-Frame-Options header denies embedding in an iframe.

Change-Id: Iadd3e93bdb7e9d41ae1d027196367448dbce19f1
Partial-Bug: 1717321
(cherry picked from commit 81a28142a065e07f16756b1bc4cfb68a98e0a2e9)

commit_message:
Allow neutron_provider_networks to be user defined

The neutron_provider_networks variable in the os_neutron role is
generated however there are times when a deployer might want to set this
option explicitly. This change gives us the ability to define
neutron_provider_networks up-front in something like a group var. If the
value is undefined it will simply carry on generating the data.

Change-Id: I232bee6f20a0221e1519c2f22e7f8ec19d5facfd
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

[{'created': '2018-02-09 07:31:23.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I986195c79d64b2c9241339358204369f86e01543
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I986195c79d64b2c9241339358204369f86e01543

commit_message:
use . instead of source.

Code conventions: Use “.” to source script files
When you have to source a script file, for example,
a credentials file to gain access to user-only or
admin-only CLI commands, use . instead of source.
See more:
http://docs.openstack.org/contributor-guide/writing-style/code-conventions

Change-Id: Ia823df50f65b26695458a509a0e0d94a4646afb3

commit_message:
Update ElasticSearch version default to 2.4.2

Devstack installs elasticsearch version 1.7.5 by default.
This version is really out of date and freezer now needs elasticsearch
that is later than 2.0.0. So i think it is better to  install a more
recent version of ES.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/092583.html

Change-Id: Iaee7ff88653b9bc840587a75b2853a0d7de98f1e

commit_message:
Change import order

[H306] Alphabetically order your imports by the full module path.
Organize your imports according to the Import order template and
Real-world Import Order Examples below.
{{stdlib imports in human alphabetical order}}
\n
{{third-party lib imports in human alphabetical order}}
\n
{{project imports in human alphabetical order}}
\n
\n
{{begin your code}}

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#import-order-template

Change-Id: Icda509ab6b48a65dc10b357acb0cec3eabe57333

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-11-02 10:47:22.000000000', 'message': "Replace directly import of logging with import oslo_log

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific
logging (like resource id's etc).

It is better to use the common logging module.

Change-Id: Ib77b01a9e9819d297874f98fa6148004aeb41b85
"}]
commit_message:
Replace directly import of logging with import oslo_log

The oslo.log (logging) configuration library provides standardized
configuration for all openstack projects. It also provides custom
formatters, handlers and support for context specific
logging (like resource id's etc).

It is better to use the common logging module.

Change-Id: Ib77b01a9e9819d297874f98fa6148004aeb41b85

messages: [{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2018-02-09 16:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-02-09 22:54:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2018-02-10 10:22:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 16:57:41.000000000', 'message': 'Handle None value for RoleConfig

RoleConfig can exist as a stack output, but have a value of None. That
case should be handled with a default value of {} where the value was
previously None.

Change-Id: I3caf31c00ab8c47d71a68eb82114fb398a47961b
Closes-Bug: #1748482
'}]
commit_message:
Handle None value for RoleConfig

RoleConfig can exist as a stack output, but have a value of None. That
case should be handled with a default value of {} where the value was
previously None.

Change-Id: I3caf31c00ab8c47d71a68eb82114fb398a47961b
Closes-Bug: #1748482

commit_message:
Add missing pacemaker cindier CA cert mounts

This adds the same CA cert mounts which other pacemaker managed
containers like rabbitmq, redis, and haproxy.
With this change, cinder-backup should work correctly when running SSL
enabled.

Depends-On: I2bd45ab879307976b3d74d627e396ba8ad22625f
Change-Id: I199c03ba36a24e6b1caf535ed285047952ac9eb0
Closes-Bug: #1747326
(cherry picked from commit 82892046f05edcc1f3ad275a6cbe778004f8675a)

commit_message:
Split out tempest API tests

This patch splits the tempest API tests out into their own jobs.

It also corrects the list of docs changes in irrelevant-files and removes
the project name from the projects list.

Change-Id: I24db0648d48fb09287c9438497ee2250748795d2

subject: Add ignore_none_type to config_template
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 20:56:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add ignore_none_type to config_template

The .cnf files can have valueless options present.
This commit ensures that these valueless options are not ignored

Addtionally, my.cnf overrides are added to the variable overrides
test file to ensure that the my.cnf file can run through the
config_template engine properly.

Change-Id: I8b09c2520c84bb43353b4c56bac157259f71b041
Closes-Bug: #1693234
(cherry picked from commit 34f52a673eee1c635030fab135b36f75867c47d2)
'}]
commit_message:
Add ignore_none_type to config_template

The .cnf files can have valueless options present.
This commit ensures that these valueless options are not ignored

Addtionally, my.cnf overrides are added to the variable overrides
test file to ensure that the my.cnf file can run through the
config_template engine properly.

Change-Id: I8b09c2520c84bb43353b4c56bac157259f71b041
Closes-Bug: #1693234
(cherry picked from commit 34f52a673eee1c635030fab135b36f75867c47d2)
