revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 20:55:20.000000000', 'message': "Add ignore_none_type to config template

It is sometimes useful to tell ConfigTemplateParser to write
out options that are valueless and not suffixed with '=' or ':',
such as when overriding a my.cnf.

This commit adds the 'ignore_none_type' attribute to the config_template
module. If this attribute is set to false, then valueless options will be
written out to the resultant INI file as-is, without the '=' or ':' suffix.

Change-Id: I5c88b2019c01b44193a5d0df9299ecce6de52f01
Partial-Bug: #1693234
(cherry picked from commit 76d5f02a32465028b47347048dde96533595036b)
"}]
commit_message:
Add ignore_none_type to config template

It is sometimes useful to tell ConfigTemplateParser to write
out options that are valueless and not suffixed with '=' or ':',
such as when overriding a my.cnf.

This commit adds the 'ignore_none_type' attribute to the config_template
module. If this attribute is set to false, then valueless options will be
written out to the resultant INI file as-is, without the '=' or ':' suffix.

Change-Id: I5c88b2019c01b44193a5d0df9299ecce6de52f01
Partial-Bug: #1693234
(cherry picked from commit 76d5f02a32465028b47347048dde96533595036b)

commit_message:
remove deployed_server from common args

deployed_server is no longer common
through out the multinode featuresets.
deploy_steps_ansible_workflow is an
alternative now.

Related-Bug: #1748315
Change-Id: I28988d30338527669da25bc764143cf57a995af9

commit_message:
Deprecate all but one variable for repo definition

This way we have just ONE variable that has the same kind of
content (a dict that has each *_repository module argument).

Change-Id: I890435ddd01c8c3382923f8c5386c78967ee10b3

subject: Disable glance v1 API by default
messages:
[{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:47:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

To be discussed if we need to do that.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:49:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

We have it enabled by default for Pike, so we should not disable it by default here.

See https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_glance/blob/6590581bbcc73f12113edbd0195c33c90fef74b9/defaults/main.yml#L70'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:57:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I am thinking of modifying glance too.
Basically I can't decide myself. It's a stable, so we shouldn't do this.
But at the same time, we should have deprecated this long ago."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-11-23 14:00:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, as it's already deployed for pike I figured it's better to leave it there. I don't think we should disable it by default."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-10 18:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Disable glance v1 API by default

The glance v1 API is scheduled to be removed in Queens and has been
disabled by default in the os_glance role. Also disable tempest testing
against the glance v1 API by default.

Change-Id: I6ef6e280e9697c45e428ec9dc519cfd0f82b651a
(cherry picked from commit f179d06211766f2bc0859c4745f1fde53ffb6019)

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I66130a22c46c7de674793a9f08c5c767a229277f

commit_message:
Replace curly quotes with straight quotes

Curly quotes usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: Ic62e4c3374337d678b6217e15fba8df67bb1b95b

commit_message:
Handle exception on searching for images

If an error occurs when search images,It will always be
a "creating" state, although the container has failed to create.
Add exception in in searching for images when create containers.

Change-Id: Ic1f3dd27e99bdf70848f7ca8750543fc30452350
Closes-bug: #1747374

commit_message:
Fix an issue on populating the pause state

If the docker container is in 'pause' state, the periodic task
will populate the container status as 'Unknown' which is incorrect.

Change-Id: I691a941869087fd87ff8deac29fd91b0f51230eb

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I0d6269d93a8fe409740a8f3095121b1a914ffd3c

subject: Improve the execution time

(1 comment)

I strongly dislike this pattern.

1) We are not using loop control which makes an ugly mess with existing items in their includes, if any.
2) The skip: True is awful, the configuration of something could be skipped and we wouldn't see it directly. If you configure x, you should include it, end of the story.
3) This shouldn't require a loop at all, we should be directly including the task, with a proper include. In our case, a static include is perfectly fine, and I don't understand why we are doing such a fancy include. It reduces readability by having a too big blob of text we don't know what for."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-05-27 22:02:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

-1 disappeared into the +1, moving to -2 :/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-07-03 12:21:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-08-15 22:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-08-15 22:15:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > I strongly dislike this pattern.
 > 
 > 1) We are not using loop control which makes an ugly mess with
 > existing items in their includes, if any.
 > 2) The skip: True is awful, the configuration of something could be
 > skipped and we wouldn't see it directly. If you configure x, you
 > should include it, end of the story.
 > 3) This shouldn't require a loop at all, we should be directly
 > including the task, with a proper include. In our case, a static
 > include is perfectly fine, and I don't understand why we are doing
 > such a fancy include. It reduces readability by having a too big
 > blob of text we don't know what for.

I'm not sure I follow being this is a cherry pick that does improve the role execution time by doing a dynamic include and skipping when nothing meets the criteria."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-08-15 22:17:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > I strongly dislike this pattern.
 > >
 > > 1) We are not using loop control which makes an ugly mess with
 > > existing items in their includes, if any.
 > > 2) The skip: True is awful, the configuration of something could
 > be
 > > skipped and we wouldn't see it directly. If you configure x, you
 > > should include it, end of the story.
 > > 3) This shouldn't require a loop at all, we should be directly
 > > including the task, with a proper include. In our case, a static
 > > include is perfectly fine, and I don't understand why we are
 > doing
 > > such a fancy include. It reduces readability by having a too big
 > > blob of text we don't know what for.
 > 
 > I'm not sure I follow being this is a cherry pick that does improve
 > the role execution time by doing a dynamic include and skipping
 > when nothing meets the criteria.

I'm of the opinion that this in fact does improve our runtime which has been impacted heavily recently. If we you'd like this pattern to change I'd suggest we get that change in master and once again cherry-pick."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-08-15 22:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-15 22:55:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Improve the execution time

This change moves the extra providers into a provider directory. These
configs have a standardized naming convention which will only include
the files needed when using a specific provider. This improves the
execution time by never loading tasks that are not needed.

Change-Id: I8ff376e878e83495c3ba07cf7c44f86c363a6be7
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit ac71bb428e1bc50fc9252783b46f29690464d135)

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: delay VPN instance startup until after first vif_plugged

This change delays VPN instance startup until after the vif_plugge
call to accomodate with a dataplane driver that needs the information
from a first vif_plugged call before a route can actually be processed
(such is the case with the recently added EVPN OVS driver).

Change-Id: I5e3dff8af48d38efa3053f891b710791dd3a9d87
Closes-Bug: 1748438

[placement] Add sending global request ID in get

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of GET in SchedulerReportClient.

Change-Id: I306ac6f5c6b67d77d91a7ba24d4d863ab3e1bf5c
Closes-Bug: #1734625

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: EVPN OVS driver, rootwrap config fix

We need to copy bagpipe-bgp root helper configuration into neutron's config, so
that neutron OVS wrapper classes find the right configuration to execute commands.

This change also tunes down the verbosity of
'ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.vlog'.

Closes-Bug: 1748446
Change-Id: I19bb7f24ce905f8e5619603ec2e7ba11a6c49ecb

Set proper yum repo priority on CentOS 7

This patch ensures that we get galera from the MariaDB repos
and not from RDO.

commit_message:
Bring idempotency to swapon

swapon will fail ("swapon failed: Device or resource busy") if run twice
with the same file.

This ensures we test if the swap file is enabled (checking in /proc),
and if not, do the proper actions.

Change-Id: I5461efcd0352f831b2051b95661861bfdcd346af
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>

subject: Stop using the tripleoupstream docker.io namespace
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 19:52:37.000000000', 'message': 'Stop using the tripleoupstream docker.io namespace

tripleoupstream is unmaintained and docker.io/tripleomaster should be
used instead.
The "latest" tag is not used in this namespace so default to a tested
tag: current-tripleo.

Change-Id: I98d3a9dd3e0ee18678f9775a530aa4ed01cece53
'}]
commit_message:
Stop using the tripleoupstream docker.io namespace

tripleoupstream is unmaintained and docker.io/tripleomaster should be
used instead.
The "latest" tag is not used in this namespace so default to a tested
tag: current-tripleo.

Change-Id: I98d3a9dd3e0ee18678f9775a530aa4ed01cece53

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 18:55:10.000000000', 'message': "Ensure mysql client ip address is an ip

If the hieradata is set to '' for the client ip address, puppet may
consider this as a true condition. This change changes out the check to
ensure that the value is an ip address, otherwise remove it from the
configuration file.

Change-Id: Idbf6bec3ec66f7018dc30e5f1e6d1ba5f48180d7
Partial-Bug: #1748180
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure mysql client ip address is an ip

If the hieradata is set to '' for the client ip address, puppet may
consider this as a true condition. This change changes out the check to
ensure that the value is an ip address, otherwise remove it from the
configuration file.

Change-Id: Idbf6bec3ec66f7018dc30e5f1e6d1ba5f48180d7
Partial-Bug: #1748180

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I9b3d09dde241cba3118520536c41e701e65e49bb

commit_message:
Fix default values in OpenStack platform

We should use by default these values:

- "user_domain_name": "default",
- "project_domain_name": "default",

Otherwise valid credentials that pass scheam do not work

Change-Id: I4f0c519281038fddbd9d40b04a1ff0cec80e05ae

commit_message:
Configure WSGI worker processes dynamically

Use WSGI worker process configuration in Apache templates inline
with other OpenStack Charms.

Change-Id: Ie873ad513201c2d2cfbbd0c14d3e85328f07ee21
Closes-Bug: 1748432
(cherry picked from commit 1eb98df671de730c199ef42b432d5229ca33a0c1)

Just a few more suggestions to get this going again if/when you upload a new patchset. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 12988, 'date': '2015-11-30 12:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12988, 'date': '2015-11-30 13:01:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

A clarification about the status of the StorPool CI system: it was disabled back in August after a request from Mike Perez because of false negatives - failures due to a failed merge.

We have recently restarted it after updating our driver - see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/192639/7 for the os-brick part and https://review.openstack.org/#/c/140733/12 for the Nova part - and it is running in silent mode, using our developer account (not our CI account) to fetch information from the OpenStack Gerrit installation.  Its logs may be viewed at http://ci-openstack.storpool.com:8080/ - although they are bit, well, unstructured there, so here are direct URLs for the last several successful runs:
http://ci-openstack.storpool.com:8080/4159/
http://ci-openstack.storpool.com:8080/4158/
http://ci-openstack.storpool.com:8080/4157/
http://ci-openstack.storpool.com:8080/4156/

It's watching commits to the openstack/cinder and openstack/os-brick projects and running the "volume" tests in the Tempest suite.

As far as I understand from the openstack-dev thread that started at http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-August/073076.html and then continued into September, ending at http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-September/073586.html - our CI system will be reenabled after somebody from the Cinder core team tells the infra team so.  So I guess it's up to the Cinder reviewers now to either let our driver in or let the infra team reenable our CI system so our driver may be fully proven and then let it in :) or, of course, let us know of any issues blocking that.

Thanks for reading this far!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-11-30 14:06:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Hi,

Thanks for the review and the chance given!  Our CI system has been reporting for the past day or so; a log of the runs that it has completed may be seen at http://logs.ci-openstack.storpool.com/ (ignore the ones before 2017-12-24 16:31 UTC, there was a change in Nova that resulted in nova-compute not being able to attach any volumes with our driver).  I'll add the volume-from-snapshot resize functionality, thanks a lot for the heads-up.  About the documenation: hm, I'm not sure that any documentation was actually written for the StorPool driver before...  Looking at the other drivers, it should be an easy enough thing to do, but it would have to be new - do you want me to do it in this change, or in a separate one later?"}, {'account_id': 12988, 'date': '2017-12-25 21:42:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 10:21:55.000000000', 'message': 'Update pylxd to 2.2.4 upper constraint as fix for lxd 2.0.11

This fix to the stable/ocata upper-constraints.txt is to ease pylxd
to 2.2.4 from 2.2.2.  This is to fix Bug #1746068.  It causes the Zuul
gate job "legacy-tempest-dsvm-lxd-ovs" to fail which means nothing can
be backported to nova-lxd for stable/ocata.

lxd 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container) and
this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and crashes
out.  This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4.

An example of a failure is: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538210/

Change-Id: Icf315725e6e5099b656ad56c3d98f9a466835439
Related-Bug: #1746068
'}, {'created': '2018-01-30 22:51:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update pylxd to 2.2.4 upper constraint as fix for lxd 2.0.11

commit_message:
Update pylxd to 2.2.4 upper constraint as fix for lxd 2.0.11

This fix to the stable/ocata upper-constraints.txt is to ease pylxd
to 2.2.4 from 2.2.2.  This is to fix Bug #1746068.  It causes the Zuul
gate job "legacy-tempest-dsvm-lxd-ovs" to fail which means nothing can
be backported to nova-lxd for stable/ocata.

lxd 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container) and
this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and crashes
out.  This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4.

An example of a failure is: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/538210/

Change-Id: Icf315725e6e5099b656ad56c3d98f9a466835439
Related-Bug: #1746068

commit_message:
kube.sh: skip get-docker when Docker is installed from distro repo

On CentOS and Fedora, kube.sh installs Docker from distro repository.
Running get-docker.sh to try installing Docker again when Docker package
is not installed using that script can cause trouble as warned in that
script itself [1].

[1] https://github.com/docker/docker-install/blob/91ca5b2/install.sh#L258-L262

Change-Id: Ib81dfeeb5b9e92d3449e66c7b0bdea86570d4990

commit_message:
Add gnocchi_storage_driver var to all group

I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd will make the gnocchi
pip package name dependent on the storage driver selected. Due to
this dynamic package naming, the repo_build will need access to this
var in order to template the package name correctly.

Change-Id: I51f910e8297e09ab888a0f4e0c9958ffbe11ad3c

subject: Release Cinder 11.1.0
messages:
[{'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-02-08 14:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:56:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I wonder if we should make this a 11.1.0 release based on the threading changes to the backup service. That's a bit more than a bugfix, so it would be good to communicate the scope of a change like that through a minor version bump."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-02-09 03:09:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks good to me.

I don't have a strong opinion about 11.0.3 vs 11.1.0 from a strict semver sense it doesn't look needed but that doesn't mean we can't do it if the cinder expects feel the change warrants additional attention and we can communicate that."}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-02-09 19:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-10 05:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Release Cinder 11.1.0

This is a mostly a bugfix release for stable/pike.  It includes
a number of bug fixes that have been backported since
early December 2017.  It is being incremented as a feature
release due to the threading changes made in the backup
service.

Change-Id: I3f7a6ac0727995c4b269b0aced7f38ec537288bd

[{'created': '2018-02-08 09:17:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add log for snapshot an instance

some drivers are interested in the snapshot performance so
provide a generic info about the time spent in doing snapshot
will be helpful to admin and developer.

Change-Id: I467a991c3da7be86640a1fae5686ef5e9e897cf5
'}]
commit_message:
Add log for snapshot an instance

some drivers are interested in the snapshot performance so
provide a generic info about the time spent in doing snapshot
will be helpful to admin and developer.

Change-Id: I467a991c3da7be86640a1fae5686ef5e9e897cf5

commit_message:
Deprecated error method

$http's deprecated custom callback method: .error() has been
removed in AngularJS 1.6. Use the standard .catch() promise
method instead.

Change-Id: I1aba520be66b91239785214f91c6e0a2ee984e55

Provide flexiblility to reduce unnecessary retry and SQL query
when process conflict with resources which required long process
time or huge among of resources.

commit_message:
Support tenacity exponential backoff retry on resource sync

Change to use tenacity as the retry library for SyncPoints.

Use exponential backoff retry waiting time. The amount of jitter per
potential conflict increases 'exponentially' (*cough* geometrically)
with each retry. The number of expected conflicts (which drops over
time) is updated at each attempt. This allows us to discover the right
rate for attempting commits across all resources that are in contention,
while actually reducing the delay between retries for any particular
resource as the number of outstanding resources drops.

Change-Id: I7d5a546a695480df309f22688b239572aa0f897a
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1591469

messages:
[{'account_id': 8246, 'date': '2018-02-02 14:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-02 14:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Unless there is an actual bug caused by the newer releases, it is acceptable to have the upper constraint higher than the lower bound in this way.

commit_message:
Recap openstacksdk to 0.9.19

There have been many changes from 0.9.x to 0.10.x to 0.11.x. We should
either raise the requirements to 0.11.x or reset the upper constraints.

Change-Id: I60db68b5692229de54d69e3a83a8042b947ce82f

commit_message:
Gate: Update multinode scripts

This PS updates the multinode deploy scripts to show output in the
gates, stop proxying the kubedns service, and use a pvc to back mariadb.

Change-Id: I78caf3f15e4c5ca33eaa1e592e8df958f13be90b

commit_message:
Monasca Ceilometer in sync with Ceilometer master

Following changes are necessary to keep monasca-ceilometer
in sync with Ceilometer upstream

* Remove api/health.py (since ceilometer v2 api was removed)
* Remove storage/impl_monasca.py (since ceilometer storage drivers were removed)
* Updated opts.py and service.py (to keep in sync with ceilometer master)
* removed api, storage driver tests
* updated /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf with new [monasca] options

Change-Id: I044f3e512db52a128bac8d5c5dcac76549a3b1c2

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2d3b47098d6effd96587c50668bf91a54953c51b

commit_message:
Fix bad usage of extend in list_image_import_opts

This change does not explode the list every time the
list_image_import_opts is called like 225a3396 did.

Change-Id: I865bface3b373e6f92bdbefa544d1fefa9da6990
Closes-Bug: #1748399
(cherry picked from commit 33e5e300040af652c82c46e7c19e2cffab4cb20c)

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Add a space between messages

The 345 DB migration shows error messages by combining base_msg
and each specific message, but it was not readable due to lack of
a space. This patch fixes it.

This comes from a review of Ie83e7bd807c2c79e5cbe1337292c2d1989d4ac03

Change-Id: I277d0bf9e392c969fcf0721ee1588e3e65d4650a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-03 17:27:50.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pylint error in DotHill drivers

The DotHill base driver accesses an instance variable before
it is defined. The way this is being done appears to be safe,
but it causes an E0203:access-member-before-definition pylint
error.

Trivial fix to make sure the variable is defined at init.

Change-Id: Ie5828dec2892e2cc94760c4a6e31445805c6c17f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pylint error in DotHill drivers

The DotHill base driver accesses an instance variable before
it is defined. The way this is being done appears to be safe,
but it causes an E0203:access-member-before-definition pylint
error.

Trivial fix to make sure the variable is defined at init.

Change-Id: Ie5828dec2892e2cc94760c4a6e31445805c6c17f

commit_message:
Revert "Create scenario tests for loadbalancers"

I think these initial load balancer patches went in the wrong direction and are not aligned to the modern tempest documentation/path. I think we need to restore Jude's work.

This reverts commit 638c4ef2a1c0a457bf70e5020fc92ca5cfc5da8f.

Change-Id: Ic42081acc0cd4c734f3d7de4efc14b7fbd79bf0b

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: fix an E-VPN OVS unit test

A unit test was testing the wrong thing, and using
an inexisting assert. This change makes the test correct
again.  The issue was not in the production code itself.

Also corrects two typos.

Change-Id: I3f8c0f245bf2d795a1ec068b9c966cf638442e1d

Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

I think it would be beneficial to add a non-voting gate to this repository in order to see how tests actually run.

Having each reviewer running a test on his own private node is okay, but it can lead to different results caused by a different set of configurations.

I ran test_basic_ops with Alex and couldn't see where it attaches the FIP.
I specifically canceled the cleanup to make sure I'm not missing anything here, and indeed it looks keypair, security groups, and FIP was not assigned properly.

To conclude,
I think a non-voting gate that invokes those scenario tests can really help here, both for this specific patch and the other patches as well."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2017-11-11 09:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 40:

'}, {'created': '2017-09-23 02:28:15.000000000', 'message': "Functional tests for load balancers

This patch implements the tempest plugin for basic load balancer
operations in Octavia.

My steps for testing in devstack environment:

- Clone octavia-tempest-plugin repo, check out this patch, install
  octavia-tempest-plugin project.
- Create a tempest work directory by running 'tempest init <workdir>'.
  In the etc/tempest.conf, add 'loadbalancer = true' in
  'service_available' section.
- Run 'tempest run --regex ^octavia_tempest_plugin'

Co-Authored-By: Lingxian Kong <anlin.kong@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibc2904f431b15dfca2ff8e38e0d4d06c1430abea
"}, {'created': '2017-10-01 11:32:27.000000000', 'message': "Create scenario tests for loadbalancers

This patch implements the tempest plugin for basic load balancer
operations in Octavia. It contains tests for loadbalancer API and
a minimal operation test for loadbalancing functionality.

Steps for testing in devstack environment:

- Clone octavia-tempest-plugin repo, check out this patch, install
  octavia-tempest-plugin project.
- Create a tempest work directory by running 'tempest init <workdir>'.
  In the etc/tempest.conf, add 'loadbalancer = true' in
  'service_available' section.
- Set a big value to 'OS_TEST_TIMEOUT' in .testr.conf
- Add or modify other related config options(image, network, flavor,
  validation, etc.)
- Run 'tempest run --regex ^octavia_tempest_plugin'

Co-Authored-By: Lingxian Kong <anlin.kong@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibc2904f431b15dfca2ff8e38e0d4d06c1430abea

commit_message:
Create scenario tests for loadbalancers

This patch implements the tempest plugin for basic load balancer
operations in Octavia. It contains tests for loadbalancer API and
a minimal operation test for loadbalancing functionality.

Steps for testing in devstack environment:

- Clone octavia-tempest-plugin repo, check out this patch, install
  octavia-tempest-plugin project.
- Create a tempest work directory by running 'tempest init <workdir>'.
  In the etc/tempest.conf, add 'loadbalancer = true' in
  'service_available' section.
- Set a big value to 'OS_TEST_TIMEOUT' in .testr.conf
- Add or modify other related config options (image, network, flavor,
  validation, etc).
- Run 'tempest run --regex ^octavia_tempest_plugin'

Co-Authored-By: Lingxian Kong <anlin.kong@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibc2904f431b15dfca2ff8e38e0d4d06c1430abea

commit_message:
Create floating ip by normal user

In real use case, it should be the end user who will create floating
ip and associate with loadbalancer vip.

Also use config_drive when creating backend server, to keep consistent
with amphora creation in octavia itself.

Tested in devstack.

Change-Id: I2cbee37f494a5775a96f8c285f0e52c0b2550d5b

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ib142ffbd6586dec5f598fc766545a559229c4d6b

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
messages: [{'account_id': 748, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:43:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 16:32:48.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib84e51e32cb8408887169a0c293f0a20b5576a70
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ib84e51e32cb8408887169a0c293f0a20b5576a70

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 07:12:09.000000000', 'message': "Use --live-restore when setting up the docker service

If you rerun an overcloud deploy command or do a minor update, while you
changed any of the options in the tripleo::profile::base::docker puppet
manifest, you are at risk of triggering a restart of the docker service
(e.g. you changed the url in the insecure_registries parameter).

This has a number of drastic consequences:
1) *All* the containers will be shut-down and restarted (this will
effectively bring down all the APIs at the same time in the overcloud
deploy case)
2) Pacemaker can potentially fail to start/stop/monitor the bundles (due
to the docker API not being available) which can have a few possible
outcomes (depending on timing): it could fence a node in case of failure
to stop, it could stop any of the bundles, it could recover from such a
situation.

Effectively now that we run stuff inside containers, restarting docker
is a bit like taking down PID 1 and starting it again.

In order to ameliorate this situation we make sure that docker is
actually started with the '--live-restore' option which was introduced
in docker 1.12 via https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/6851 and avoids
restarting all the containers when the docker daemon gets restarted.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib3ea6de7f235d2a2d53a6576e0876ab171128b34
Closes-Bug: #1747851
"}, {'created': '2018-02-07 11:11:48.000000000', 'message': "Use --live-restore when setting up the docker service

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use --live-restore when setting up the docker service

If you rerun an overcloud deploy command or do a minor update, while you
changed any of the options in the tripleo::profile::base::docker puppet
manifest, you are at risk of triggering a restart of the docker service
(e.g. you changed the url in the insecure_registries parameter).

This has a number of drastic consequences:
1) *All* the containers will be shut-down and restarted (this will
effectively bring down all the APIs at the same time in the overcloud
deploy case)
2) Pacemaker can potentially fail to start/stop/monitor the bundles (due
to the docker API not being available) which can have a few possible
outcomes (depending on timing): it could fence a node in case of failure
to stop, it could stop any of the bundles, it could recover from such a
situation.

Effectively now that we run stuff inside containers, restarting docker
is a bit like taking down PID 1 and starting it again.

In order to ameliorate this situation we make sure that docker is
actually started with the '--live-restore' option which was introduced
in docker 1.12 via https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/6851 and avoids
restarting all the containers when the docker daemon gets restarted.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ib3ea6de7f235d2a2d53a6576e0876ab171128b34
Closes-Bug: #1747851

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: If8dce8ddefe953ce4c1deb05050a33d1f61a3dfd

commit_message:
[Upgrade] Reuse OVS workaround in docker neutron ovs agent

In puppet neutron ovs agent we apply workaround which we forgot
to reuse in the docker service definition.

Resolves: rhbz#1536142
Closes-Bug: #1744126

Change-Id: If3a63cad754a875f56b604033c1aff498243140c

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration

Change-Id: I22305247d036cd7bf1813b06374be079c912f08a
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I22305247d036cd7bf1813b06374be079c912f08a

commit_message:
Fixed integration of the unit tests with PosrgeSQL

* Corrected the path to the mistral config file in a unit test
* Minor improvement in the run_tests.sh script
* Fixed unstable the `test_rerun_join_with_branch_errors` and
test_rerun_on_join_task test. task3 id is properly passed now
* Removed unused `insert_or_ignore` api and tests. This api
broke the test in PostgreSQL case
* Passed correct value to the filter in
`test_filter_action_definitions_by_has_filter` test

Closes-Bug: #1736821
Change-Id: I2ce3d2e1be001d9c0c76ebe5293b2bf578a7160b
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>
(cherry picked from commit cf0484ad2e0ee80f8ae7d09961dd6fe2b62d9010)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I152a560e0dd44311873096130b34cacfb0a2b238

commit_message:
Remove 2 redundant methods

I suppose that methods get_resource_manager_extra_kwargs and
add_resource_manager_extra_kwargs_hook were designed in those days when
Nova API had extensions.
Nowdays, Nova API has strict schema validation of requests, so no
additional arguments are allowed and these methods look redundant.

The fact that get_resource_manager_extra_kwargs lists of the objects
added by add_resource_manager_extra_kwargs_hook whereas
add_resource_manager_extra_kwargs_hook is not called anywhere
doesn't add chances for leaving these methods in our code.

Compatibility: both methods are designed for CLI and the CLI behaviour
  will not change after removing them, so we can do a cleanup without
  following standard deprecation cycle.

Change-Id: Id61457c3db8a17e2294dc579b2519873927fec48

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id7f8aa633240d50ec9845d00f285684208a215c1

commit_message:
firewall: control ipv6 services and files

In Ife465c2c6739c3cbfb9923ed97f370baa745739c we're about to
include ::firewall::linux::redhat so we need to make sure ipv6 is
enabled (disabled by default in puppetlabs-firewall), so we can
control IPv6 services & files as well.

Change-Id: Ibafdeaa6b3430f3cecebae9eb4b63360c90d8b3a
Related-Bug: #1747960

openSUSE mirros are now configurable in the
openstack-ansible-openstack-hosts role so we need to make sure we are
using the internal OpenStack ones when running in zuul. This patch also
modifies the code to check for /etc/nodepool instead of
/etc/nodepool/provider because the latter doesn't seem to exist anymore.

commit_message:
test-set-nodepool-vars: Add nodepool mirror discovery for openSUSE

openSUSE mirros are now configurable in the
openstack-ansible-openstack-hosts role so we need to make sure we are
using the internal OpenStack ones when running in zuul. This patch also
modifies the code to check for /etc/nodepool instead of
/etc/nodepool/provider because the latter doesn't seem to exist anymore.

Change-Id: I6df997e13f678faaddac8b5d1818f2906bac08ec
(cherry picked from commit d5cda7aacc3e2075fc5401248dbafda19333cad8)

'}, {'created': '2018-02-08 14:14:48.000000000', 'message': '[openstack] Change identifiers for floating ips

Neutron API of pre-newton OpenStack releases doesn't support any
identifiers for Floating IPs. That is why, to provide a good cleanup we
decided to identify those resources from attached ports.

Actually, it was a wrong decision and in case of existing users case
this feature provides distructive actions.

From OpenStack Newton the "description" field appeared in Floating IP
resource and we can use it as identifier. Such behaviour can help to
remove a bunch of "guessing code".

In case of pre-newton releases, the new config option
(openstack.pre_newton_neutron) should be used to identify that "description"
field should not be added to a resource.

Change-Id: I6b44c09197c0cedd1e11b9dc1b363345051366d4
'}]
commit_message:
[openstack] Change identifiers for floating ips

Neutron API of pre-newton OpenStack releases doesn't support any
identifiers for Floating IPs. That is why, to provide a good cleanup we
decided to identify those resources from attached ports.

Actually, it was a wrong decision and in case of existing users case
this feature provides distructive actions.

From OpenStack Newton the "description" field appeared in Floating IP
resource and we can use it as identifier. Such behaviour can help to
remove a bunch of "guessing code".

In case of pre-newton releases, the new config option
(openstack.pre_newton_neutron) should be used to identify that "description"
field should not be added to a resource.

Change-Id: I6b44c09197c0cedd1e11b9dc1b363345051366d4

commit_message:
Avoid explicit requirement for groups to exist

The current templating for nova.conf checks if the 'inventory_hostname'
of the current host is found within the combined lists of hosts for the
default groups of all services other than nova-compute. This requires
that each of those explicitly mentioned groups exist in the inventory
and future upkeep if any of those default groups are renamed, added to,
or removed.

Instead, lookup each group defined in the 'nova_services' variable for
all services other than nova-compute and check for an intersection of
those groups and the current host's 'group_names'.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540613
Change-Id: Ib3fe93e4f6a9f473a599cd4ac3e96ee9ac919108

commit_message:
Fix message type payload in rotate_fernet_keys workflow

The rotate_fernet_keys workflow had a copy/paste error. It was using the
wrong message type in the zaqar message. This sets it to the correct type.
The patch also includes streamlining of the messaging, to follow a better
pattern.

Change-Id: I5ddf433f39a530afe40fe13e551a91577949f9f2
Closes-Bug: #1747945

commit_message:
Fixes SSL/TLS with OpenDaylight docker service

The ODL private key, cert, and CA cert were missing in the puppet
container config.  These are required during puppet stage in order to
create the proper keystores in ODL.  The files are not needed during the
service bringup time, because the information is built into the
keystore created by puppet.

Closes-Bug: 1747700

Change-Id: If548fdba836104412bf20e8e05ecf6a5058aa318
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

(1 comment)

I think we need to make sure that we're doing proper transactional updates, at least to any resources that we share with other orchestrators (such as the clusterinfo). 

Ideally, we'd do that everywhere we update something so that we can play nice with calicoctl updates to the same resources, but I think that's out of scope."}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:30:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 19461, 'date': '2018-02-09 14:29:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Adapt for new Calico data model (v3)

- Infrastructure for v3 data model

- Endpoint handling -> v3 as well as v1

  Note that we keep the v1 handling as well, for communication with the
  DHCP agent, so as to avoid having to update the DHCP agent code as
  well (at least for now).

- Profile handling -> v3

- Datastore initialization -> v3

- Switch back to using 'master' PPA

Change-Id: Ib393cc6b1c00d0f4fa1a2f8a75ead4c34b9554da

[{'created': '2018-02-09 13:46:00.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ief131f3183b41c03d46b441e225c046037acc270
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ief131f3183b41c03d46b441e225c046037acc270

commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox jobs

Convert all tox jobs to be Zuul v3 native. This uses the shared
openstack-tox as base.

Remove the now unused playbooks.

Change-Id: I3da1ca8a55f0bf6953a68cb5dae67218a0792cf5

subject: Fix typos
messages:
[{'account_id': 27563, 'date': '2018-02-09 07:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-09 07:24:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2018-02-09 07:24:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-09 08:55:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

Thanks for the contribution, but those files come from Hadoop and we want to keep them the same. If you want to fix the typos, please contribute the patch to Hadoop first. See also:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542567/
https://docs.openstack.org/sahara/latest/contributor/development-guidelines.html#modification-of-upstream-files'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-09 18:05:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 17:22:58.000000000', 'message': "Handle missing groupby_key in _group_runs_by_key

The _group_runs_by_key() helper function is there to re-organize the
data grouped by a metadata value. However, it was not fault tolerant
if the metadata key used for grouping was missing from any of the list
of runs. In the course of normal operation this should not occur,
because the metadata should be the same for all jobs in the OpenStack
subunit2sql db. But, due to a worker bug and/or a service restart we're
encountering a run that's missing a few metadata values. To make this
error non-fatal this commit augments the function to just ignore runs
where the groupby_key is not in the metadata.

Change-Id: I87087c8e3a985d883db78e008fd14f4fb9ac4e24
"}]
commit_message:
Handle missing groupby_key in _group_runs_by_key

The _group_runs_by_key() helper function is there to re-organize the
data grouped by a metadata value. However, it was not fault tolerant
if the metadata key used for grouping was missing from any of the list
of runs. In the course of normal operation this should not occur,
because the metadata should be the same for all jobs in the OpenStack
subunit2sql db. But, due to a worker bug and/or a service restart we're
encountering a run that's missing a few metadata values. To make this
error non-fatal this commit augments the function to just ignore runs
where the groupby_key is not in the metadata.

Change-Id: I87087c8e3a985d883db78e008fd14f4fb9ac4e24

commit_message:
Revert "Fix wrong usage of extend in list_image_import_opts"

This change will duplicate the entries for each run of the list
function.

This reverts commit 225a33967e5f210e1dae9ec18f1132eff8abacbd.

Change-Id: I5be8c5d0e9c83cde64470eeaa27fc62bf393f300

subject: Update OBS install docs for v2 removal
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 14:51:47.000000000', 'message': 'Update OBS install docs for v2 removal

With the removal of the v2 API, there is no reason to keep listening on
multiple ports. Update the OBS install guide to only mention the one
port. The openSUSE openstack-keystone package does not provide a default
vhost config file so we can update this independently of any package
changes in the distro. This also removes a few incorrect notes, one
claiming that the distro package installed and started the nonexistent
eventlet service and one claiming that port 5000 only allowed non-admin
access.

Change-Id: Ic06af94335598e0aadac20874d177e531069548a
'}]
commit_message:
Update OBS install docs for v2 removal

With the removal of the v2 API, there is no reason to keep listening on
multiple ports. Update the OBS install guide to only mention the one
port. The openSUSE openstack-keystone package does not provide a default
vhost config file so we can update this independently of any package
changes in the distro. This also removes a few incorrect notes, one
claiming that the distro package installed and started the nonexistent
eventlet service and one claiming that port 5000 only allowed non-admin
access.

Change-Id: Ic06af94335598e0aadac20874d177e531069548a

(1 comment)

I take it back.  We should remove the part of _delete_inventory that uses the DELETE API, and keep the part that uses PUT {}.  This is one of three spots in report client where we assume things about how the placement API increments the generation.  We should either document that behavior (not good IMO) or not do those things - see bug 1746075 [1].  Either way, it's trivial to make the point moot for this code path.

Since this patch is about removing stuff, that chunk should just be left alone, and the DELETE path removed in a separate patch.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1746075"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-01-30 21:41:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't think I agree Eric, but very happy to be convinced otherwise. We already don't use the code that is being removed because we always have the available newer microversion.

Whether that is the right call or not is a separate discussion but what this change does is preserve the current behavior while removing _currently_ dead code.

If we want to go back to the other style of inventory cleanup (it's not clear that we have fully resolved that conversation other than to know that right now in the middle of feature freeze is probably the wrong time to make changes) we can put it in at any time."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-01-30 23:16:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Remove microversion fallback code from report client

For Queens, we've committed nova to using microversion 1.14 of the
placement API. That means the nova report client does not need to
fall back to earlier versions for some methods when removing
inventory, putting allocations, or ensuring that resource classes
exist.

This change removes fallback code that was only run when a 406
response was received from the placement service. Associated
tests that prove the falling back have been removed, and tests
that mocked methods that may have been fallen back have had
those mocks removed.

Change-Id: I2563213dc3b184049af336f0807c4cb4690a9f9a

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary arguments in notification methods

There are methods for versioned notifications
in nova/compute/utils.py.
Remove unnecessary arguments in them.

* notify_about_instance_create

  Versioned notifications when creating a server are emitted
  in the compute manager only.
  The 'source' argument is not necessary.
  So remove it.

* notify_about_volume_attach_detach

  Versioned notifications when attaching/detaching a volume
  to/from a server are emitted in the compute manager only.
  The 'source' argument is not necessary.
  So remove it.

* notify_about_instance_rescue_action

  This method is only utilized in the 'rescue' action.
  The 'action' argument is not necessary.
  Versioned notifications for the rescue action are emitted
  in the compute manager only.
  The 'source' argument is not necessary.
  So remove them.

* notify_about_volume_swap

  This method is only utilized in the 'volume_swap' action.
  The 'action' argument is not necessary.
  So remove it.

Change-Id: I678d4b634f74051eb069c792ec32b2fc317b73e8

commit_message:
[placement] Move body examples to an isolated directory

JSON body examples of Placement API reference
are in the same directroy where *.inc files exist.

This patch moves JSON body examples to an isolated directory
in order to make it easier to maintain the API reference.

Change-Id: I8fd587100d22bd10dd4b2b2f1b25c5ecc7fc8537

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I7e922072663fc1b6f2e1322cbee559b604f21b25

YAML configuration usage is broken in monasca collector (list object has
no attribute 'items').

[1].https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/configuration-options/index.html#security.authorization'}, {'account_id': 18665, 'date': '2018-02-09 13:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26895, 'date': '2018-02-09 15:03:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 23:55:54.000000000', 'message': 'Remove security.authorization option from mongos

The "security.authorization" option is only usable for
mongod and not for mongos service.

When this option is applied to /etc/mongos.conf configuration
file, mongos service doesn't start.

Change-Id: Id798d7269ee80706002bbebe2ff666fc2fecdd1e
Closes-Bug: #1748322
'}]
commit_message:
Remove security.authorization option from mongos

The "security.authorization" option is only usable for
mongod and not for mongos service.

When this option is applied to /etc/mongos.conf configuration
file, mongos service doesn't start.

Change-Id: Id798d7269ee80706002bbebe2ff666fc2fecdd1e
Closes-Bug: #1748322

According the @jistr's comment: We should be able to mount anything as :ro,z instead of the manual chcon. Chcon is not a safe way, because the changes will get overriden on nearest restorecon. Allow containers to run on hosts with SELinux enforcing.
* Make sure unpriv containers' state in /var, /etc, /srv
  and so on, use :z for volumes bind-mounted.
* Always use privileged flag for containers that bind-mount
  `/run` as enforcing SELinux does not allow containers to
  access the host sockets by default. Excludes the docker
  socket mounted for unpriv containers.
* Use --ipc=host instead of bind-mounting /dev/shm.
* For configuration data dirs bind-mounted from /var/lib,
  define and persist the context by the deploy steps tasks,
  to not repeat :z *many* places.
* Manage /var/lib/config-data with the deploy steps
  preparation tasks as well.

Partial-bug: #1682179
Related-bug: #1723003

Change-Id: I9d96d3846a9f80356e50ffd232488ded9f9a15af
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Allow SELinux shared context for containers state

Allow containers to run on hosts with SELinux enforcing.
* Make sure unpriv containers' state in /var, /etc, /srv
  and so on, use :z for volumes bind-mounted.
* Always use privileged flag for containers that bind-mount
  `/run` as enforcing SELinux does not allow containers to
  access the host sockets by default. Excludes the docker
  socket mounted for unpriv containers.
* Use --ipc=host instead of bind-mounting /dev/shm.
* For configuration data dirs bind-mounted from /var/lib,
  define and persist the context by the deploy steps tasks,
  to not repeat :z *many* places.
* Manage /var/lib/config-data with the deploy steps
  preparation tasks as well.

Partial-bug: #1682179
Related-bug: #1723003

Change-Id: I9d96d3846a9f80356e50ffd232488ded9f9a15af
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
apparmor: Fix use with directory based OSD's

Ensure that directory based OSD's under /srv/ceph can hard
link when apparmor is in enforce mode. If not, then links go
missing over time and the ceph-osd daemons eventually abort.

Change-Id: I7cc25f5d436204d1f47c9a3a67a15f27c16b7505
Closes-Bug: 1748426

commit_message:
Remove some moved slave scripts

These scripts are only used by legacy jobs that life in
openstack-zuul-jobs, move them over to the repo and remove
them from getting installed in our nodes.

Remove unused script package-gerrit.sh, it's not used for some time
(pre-Zuul v3 conversion).

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/542649
Change-Id: I9f3d69cff5bc88acd9d2252c0b563ec6f5084f65

commit_message:
Add create ACL for almanach

The almanach team wants to create new stable branches, add permissions for
that. Reacting to http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-February/127163.html
We wanted to create the appropriate branch: stable/queens

Change-Id: I08e5aa486369ac5c6bc06df9acaf1626a4195e81

commit_message:
dnm: test n8g-bgpvpn switch to new DB facade

This change is just a trigger to see if I5a395560ea0573c92a3c615d7dbcb343d6983a78
has side-effects on the networking-bgpvpn driver for ODL.

Change-Id: I471aec35cf04e56e735ae2b158470d64e61259f1
Depends-On: I5a395560ea0573c92a3c615d7dbcb343d6983a78

commit_message:
Adding /usr/share/neutron/server config dir

  This config-dir is included in default neutron-server
  exec command as explained in the bug

Change-Id: I22023a645c4752c6371b5cea5ab69c7503991887
Closes-Bug: #1748173
Signed-off-by: Ricardo Noriega <rnoriega@redhat.com>

Fix namespace label

This patch set fixes the namespace labels and adds in a new log file to
describe all namespaces to troubleshoot gate issues where labels are not
applied properly.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Move tripleo-quickstart to be independent

Starting in Queens cycle, tripleo-quickstart will be independent.
Indeed this project doesn't follow milestones and branching for now.

Note it might change in the future for tripleo-quickstart-extras but we
haven't decided yet.

Change-Id: Ia07bbbd7b0766d4ebc3ac94f19728323f5bbace3

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie636eb6f51ceb08f7150ea0c62ea186fc99df067

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-05 16:13:50.000000000', 'message': 'Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I8d68d847edebce37e37e671a1ad3eadddd4354e8
Closes-Bug: #1747453
'}]
commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

Currently strings in Django templates cannot be translated
because the current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html"
does not match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I8d68d847edebce37e37e671a1ad3eadddd4354e8
Closes-Bug: #1747453

commit_message:
Update Delete Deployment Confirmation message

This patch updates the delete deployment confirmation message so that
the term "deployment" is used instead of "stack".

Also, this patch removes the trash can icon used on the "Delete
Deployment" button on the deployment details page.

Change-Id: Ifac6311e9df32720fc3fe5f3edb9c1c7b9c5ea3e
Closes-Bug: #1677004

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 14:45:32.000000000', 'message': "Make build reproducible

Currently in master, cloudkitty is leaking the build hostname in the
cloudkitty.conf file when generating it. This makes the entire package
no reproducible.

This patch adds a sample_default= argument when defining host=, so that
the default value when generating the config file is *not* the hostname
of the build host. This doesn't change at all the behavior, which will
use the hostname FQDN if the value isn't set by the user.

Change-Id: I59eb50018dd895f40ff949123c4ab78360c74850
"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 14:46:08.000000000', 'message': "Make build reproducible

Currently in master, cloudkitty is leaking the build hostname in the
cloudkitty.conf file when generating it. This makes the entire package
no reproducible.

This patch adds a sample_default= argument when defining host=, so that
the default value when generating the config file is *not* the hostname
of the build host. This doesn't change at all the behavior, which will
use the hostname FQDN if the value isn't set by the user.

Change-Id: I59eb50018dd895f40ff949123c4ab78360c74850
"}]
commit_message:
Make build reproducible

Currently in master, cloudkitty is leaking the build hostname in the
cloudkitty.conf file when generating it. This makes the entire package
no reproducible.

This patch adds a sample_default= argument when defining host=, so that
the default value when generating the config file is *not* the hostname
of the build host. This doesn't change at all the behavior, which will
use the hostname FQDN if the value isn't set by the user.

Change-Id: I59eb50018dd895f40ff949123c4ab78360c74850

commit_message:
Fix coverage job

diff-cover compares HEAD with origin/master branch by default.
Zuul uses git operations to mirror the local prepared git repos
to the remote nodes. And all branch names are without 'origin',
so need to specify the branch name for coverage job.

Change-Id: Iaba21de10f6cf705e110cd60cb004502bb37515d

commit_message:
check consistency of BGPVPN types in Port routes of type "bgpvpn"

Add a check to prevent adding a route of type 'bgpvpn' on a Port
Association, to a BGPVPN of a type differing from the type of the
BGPVPN associated to the Port.

Change-Id: I71ff56acb33695f23238b3b1dc0b8ec0dc6eebfc

commit_message:
Consolidate legacy scripts

Create new role legacy-copy-jenkins-scripts to populate
/usr/local/jenkins/slave_scripts.

Move existing scripts from playbooks/legacy to the files directory of
the new role.

Use the new role instead of a task.

Change-Id: I2dcfdf46f0d953afa8100557488a393962dba9bb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-07 16:18:59.000000000', 'message': 'switch to use new DB facade

Beyond obvious reasons to try to migrate to the new facade, bug
17446996 is leading us into using the new DB facade for BGPVPN
OVObjects used by bagpipe driver.

However, unless we switched all DB operations to the new DB facade,
we have a situation where we mix both old and new facade, which
is a known source of issues.

This change switches all DB operation to use the new DB facade.

Change-Id: I5a395560ea0573c92a3c615d7dbcb343d6983a78
Depends-On: Ie4ad57f6357c59f2a978467099642b08e730133e
Related-Bug: 1746996

commit_message:
switch to use new DB facade

Beyond obvious reasons to try to migrate to the new facade, bug
17446996 is leading us into using the new DB facade for BGPVPN
OVObjects used by bagpipe driver.

However, unless we switched all DB operations to the new DB facade,
we have a situation where we mix both old and new facade, which
is a known source of issues.

This change switches all DB operation to use the new DB facade.

Change-Id: I5a395560ea0573c92a3c615d7dbcb343d6983a78
Depends-On: Ie4ad57f6357c59f2a978467099642b08e730133e
Related-Bug: 1746996

commit_message:
Add blazar project to project-data

Blazar project became an official project in Queens cycle. This
patch appends a reference for blazar docs.

Change-Id: Id512d777ae7f46d212f67fd887a9a2a97b488538

commit_message:
VGPU: Modify the example of vgpu white_list set

`enabled_vgpu_types` flag has been set in nova.conf to set enabled
vgpu type of current host. The example is wrong.
Modify the example to avoid mislead.

Change-Id: If7a150d4d28609cabeb5f513bbd134a969fca17c
Closes-Bug: #1746217

commit_message:
Add devstack-plugin-container to QA team

The repo devstack-plugin-container is a devstack plugin for
installing container engines such as Docker. This plugin is
currently used by a few official services such as Zun,
Kuryr-libnetwork, Kuryr-kubernetes, and Fuxi. This patch proposes
to include devstack-plugin-container as a deliverable of QA team.

Change-Id: I474bf587c0a9c9c560fbe4fde108940df379e863

commit_message:
Fixed integration of the unit tests with PosrgeSQL

* Corrected the path to the mistral config file in a unit test
* Minor improvement in the run_tests.sh script
* Fixed unstable the `test_rerun_join_with_branch_errors` and
test_rerun_on_join_task test. task3 id is properly passed now
* Removed unused `insert_or_ignore` api and tests. This api
broke the test in PostgreSQL case
* Passed correct value to the filter in
`test_filter_action_definitions_by_has_filter` test

Change-Id: I2ce3d2e1be001d9c0c76ebe5293b2bf578a7160b
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

Ok, thank you Dmitrii."}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 15:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Fixed a minor problem that caused func test failure in the test itself.

Waiting for it to finish on my environment now - will kick off a full recheck afterwards here.'}, {'account_id': 25664, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Dmitrii, Should the configurations from Newton directory be updated as well?
https://github.com/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway/tree/master/templates/newton'}, {'account_id': 935, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:27:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

charm-recheck'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 16:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Anton, there is a templating system in charm-helpers based on jinja2 which takes care of reusing templates from previous OpenStack versions unless a newer one exists.

The bulk of that code is in get_loader:

https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/blob/master/charmhelpers/contrib/openstack/templating.py#L43-L88

I also have a personal note on this - placed it here without modifications https://gist.github.com/dshcherb/64bc3831cfc779c5668f94f4a837a1db in case you need to review how it works for future reference.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:13:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Well, actually, you are right.

There are newton templates as well which I overlooked.'}, {'account_id': 25664, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:19:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Thanks for your comment about the template system!'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 19:46:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

DEBUG:runner:2018-02-08 18:28:06,492 service_restarted_since DEBUG: Attempt 0 to get neutron-metering-agent proc start time on neutron-gateway/0 failed

Got the same failure on a manual run.

juju config neutron-gateway openstack-origin
cloud:trusty-mitaka

The agent is looping with failure

https://paste.ubuntu.com/26542565/

2018-02-08 19:03:52.870 13968 INFO neutron.services.metering.drivers.iptables.iptables_driver [-] Loading interface driver openvswitch
2018-02-08 19:03:52.871 13968 CRITICAL neutron [-] ValueError: Empty module name

~~~~

Apparently iptables_driver.py as of neutron master branch still uses importutils directly instead of using stevedore's DriverManager so I will have to revert the interface_driver change for metering_agent.ini

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/a0d705c0e8991b2a0b2774929c85bf71cc2a18da/neutron/services/metering/drivers/iptables/iptables_driver.py#L110-L114"}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 19:48:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-08 22:10:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 8992, 'date': '2018-02-09 02:30:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

commit_message:
load interface_driver using a symbolic name

Instead of relying on a full class path let's use symbolic names and
namespaces from setup.cfg which relies on stevedore to use a proper
class. This can only be used for code-paths that do not rely on direct
usage of importlib which is not the case for the metering agent, which
is why its config is left untouched.

Co-Authored-By: Anton Kremenetsky <akremenetsky@dev.rtsoft.ru>
Co-Authored-By: Dmitrii Shcherbakov <dmitrii.shcherbakov@canonical.com>
Change-Id: I4d3389a0fe376fed87265f51fdd69caf14fb3b16
Closes-Bug: #1747964

commit_message:
Use default policy in code

Delete policy.json from repo since we can use policies registered
in code.

We can also change default policy rules through below steps:

  - generate policy.yaml and copy to /etc/barbican
  - configure `policy_file=policy.yaml` in `oslo_policy` section
  - uncomment rules in policy.yaml and make changes as we desire
  - restart barbican api service
  - test whether new rules take effect on corresponding API

Change-Id: Ia64eac1eb4e30457b323c6ab99d26d3d40c28060

commit_message:
Encode libvirt domain XML in UTF-8

Creating a VM with a non-ASCII name results in an error. Resolve
this by encoding the libvirt domain XML in utf-8.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1730756
Change-Id: I7afce618deca3baaa96605a6b48c1c2ef4a5f2a5
(cherry picked from commit 784c0ecdc37e7a2ac5e9b5ad9de4f5d88190a7dc)

[{'created': '2018-02-07 18:35:29.000000000', 'message': 'Tags in workflows were not being properly checked

If an invalid tag section was specified, Mistral would throw a 500,
with no useful error message. This makes the tags get checked and

Closes-Bug: #1747950

commit_message:
Tags in workflows were not being properly checked

If an invalid tag section was specified, Mistral would throw a 500,
with no useful error message. This makes the tags get checked and
throws a proper error if so.

Change-Id: If2ae69ef76a857bcafe1e4b3d72956c6deeeea09
Closes-Bug: #1747950

commit_message:
Filtering networks or routers by non-existing tenants return an empty list

When networks or routers are filtered by a tenant which does not exist,
there will be return a list no filtered. But we expect an empty list.

Change-Id: I8faca01ab67240a76818d6752f796a6de3c51b5f
Closes-Bug: #1744846

commit_message:
Support specified security groups when creating a port

This patch allows users to specifie security groups when creating
a port. After a port is created, the backend specifies a 'default'
security group. To be consistent with this configuration, the page
initialization also defaults to a 'default' security group.

Change-Id: I13fe4648c3b5f8311602844e08044af8f7b47fd8
Closes-Bug:#1746985

[{'created': '2018-01-19 21:41:50.000000000', 'message': 'Add LMA armada check to openstack-helm

This adds a check to openstack-helm for deploying the LMA services
with armada. This includes: prometheus, elasticsearch, kibana,
fluentbit, fluentd, node-exporter, kube-state-metrics, the
openstack-exporter, and grafana

commit_message:
Add checks for armada fullstack deployment

This adds a check to openstack-helm for deploying the full osh +
lma stack with armada. It deploys a manifest that will install
a rabbitmq and memcached per openstack service

Depends-On: Id58f85f150054d82c047bd360258ebe9e571360f
Change-Id: Ie2cb29279a7e47570b7faee82828f7ec753ab73f

subject: Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone
messages: [{'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-01-30 20:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-01-31 16:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-02-09 13:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-30 20:02:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone

The logic to check for insecure Keystone would only validate if
both HAproxy and Keystone SSL is installed.  However, in the case
where SSL happens at either of those (ex. SSL at HAproxy only),
then it would still declare it as insecure (it is not however
as we're hitting the VIP which does SSL termination).

This changes the behaviour to check if the protocol is HTTPs and
either the Keystone or HAproxy certificates are defined then it
considers it as secure, otherwise it is insecure.

Manual backport of 15e2d85f4136a3bcbd9d8e1d919686a9a361e6c6 due to file
name differences and lack of 'keystone_service_publicuri*' variables.

Closes-Bug: #1745479
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: I3683c5d50cab2d321337c71bed565d2e2ab861fc
"}]
commit_message:
Fix logic to check for insecure Keystone

The logic to check for insecure Keystone would only validate if
both HAproxy and Keystone SSL is installed.  However, in the case
where SSL happens at either of those (ex. SSL at HAproxy only),
then it would still declare it as insecure (it is not however
as we're hitting the VIP which does SSL termination).

This changes the behaviour to check if the protocol is HTTPs and
either the Keystone or HAproxy certificates are defined then it
considers it as secure, otherwise it is insecure.

Manual backport of 15e2d85f4136a3bcbd9d8e1d919686a9a361e6c6 due to file
name differences and lack of 'keystone_service_publicuri*' variables.

Closes-Bug: #1745479
Co-Authored-By: Logan V <logan2211@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Mohammed Naser <mnaser@vexxhost.com>
Change-Id: I3683c5d50cab2d321337c71bed565d2e2ab861fc

Blazar changed its release numbering 0.4.0 to 1.0.0 series in
middle of Queens cycle. It fails to include releasenotes related to
0.4.0 numbering.

[{'created': '2018-02-09 11:16:54.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic6aa38f3b5d9a706a2e9ab3257a81da6d72da0ee
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic6aa38f3b5d9a706a2e9ab3257a81da6d72da0ee

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-09 08:53:38.000000000', 'message': 'Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: Ia300244f358f0ad939e1d755649c41107deec53a
Closes-Bug: #1741051
'}]
commit_message:
Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: Ia300244f358f0ad939e1d755649c41107deec53a
Closes-Bug: #1741051

subject: Mark neutron-lbaas as deprecated
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-01 00:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-01 13:31:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)

Question for cores: does LBaaS deprecation mean we shouldn't waste time updating the API defs, API ref, etc. in neutron-lib? I see at least 1 other patch to fix LBaaS API ref, but now I'm questioning if we should even consider it."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-01 13:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-01 23:55:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-02 07:18:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Question for cores: does LBaaS deprecation mean we shouldn't waste
 > time updating the API defs, API ref, etc. in neutron-lib? I see at
 > least 1 other patch to fix LBaaS API ref, but now I'm questioning
 > if we should even consider it.

IMHO we should if there are proposed fixes for it. This API is deprecated but it will be still here since 1 - 1,5 year so it's quite long time when someone can still use it :)"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-05 23:53:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Question for cores: does LBaaS deprecation mean we shouldn't waste time updating the API defs, API ref, etc. in neutron-lib? I see at least 1 other patch to fix LBaaS API ref, but now I'm questioning if we should even consider it.

neutron-lbaas API is now deprecated but the end of support is not decided yet and it continues to be used. I see value in maintaining LBaaS-API related stuff in neutron-lib.

Situation may be different on API references, API definitions and others (if any).
- The API references is worth maintained until it is dropped. The main consumers are users.
- I am not sure the API definitions in neutron-lib needs to be maintained. The main consumers are other neutron-related projects and at now I don't know we have how many consumers of neutron-lbaas related stuffs.
Anyway a sudden change is not good."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-05 23:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-07 00:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-07 00:45:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I hope I captured your comments correctly, if not please ping me in #openstack-lbaas'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-02-07 07:55:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:00:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7715, 'date': '2018-02-09 01:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-09 08:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks. It looks nice now.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-02-09 14:21:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 4b42b9dea58260bee54323f6dab3e627ea48a076'}]

commit_message:
Mark neutron-lbaas as deprecated

This patch marks the LBaaS 2.0 API, listed as part of the neutron API
reference, as deprecated and includes a note in the LBaaS API reference
that neutron-lbaas is deprecated.

Change-Id: Ibe564b62692aba786d953cedb0bd5f3817f9c238

commit_message:
sphinxext: Warn if namespace or command pattern invalid

Calling the Sphinx extension with an invalid namespace or command
pattern currently results in a silent failure. Correct this oversight by
raising a warning, which will cause a build failure is
'warning-is-error' is enabled.

Change-Id: I63d18c86931d752c3a680e84a69df53bc04e7dfd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
tests: test-swift-upgrades.sh: Drop Ansible verbosity

The upgrade tests are very noisy since Ansible verbosity is set too
high. This makes debugging problems very painful so drop the verbosity
level and let users increase it if desired.

Change-Id: Id256efff664c58d62aaf7b9e23c7df6953032573

commit_message:
Refactor the create port form to workflow

The neutron API allows the users to specify security group(s) when
creating a port [1], but at the moment the Horizon can only modify
the security group of a port by 'Edit Port' row action.

As with edit port workflow, refactoring the creation of port form
to workflow is to support the creation of ports as well as the
assignment of security groups. Since the change may be more, this
patch only contains reconstruct the form, support the security
groups will be submitted in another patch.

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/index.html#create-port

Change-Id: Ie7e5242cc885b6eb0316f695453b0d2844360d67
Related-bug: #1746985

[{'created': '2018-02-09 09:49:05.000000000', 'message': 'Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: Id32e21a90ad33264545bb32fb53cc98ecd4f29b1
Closes-Bug: #1741051
'}]
commit_message:
Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: Id32e21a90ad33264545bb32fb53cc98ecd4f29b1
Closes-Bug: #1741051
